commit_message:
ci: Fix and address all tox -e docs warnings

Warning is now treated as an error to prevent backlog of genuine
formatting issues, e.g. improper references, indentation and not listing
newly added specs into the index.

Change-Id: I3b8a1ce7f931bfd83db36600dc74d1d0c2ef293e

commit_message:
Dont package .pickl file

because it is not needed and will cause packages to differ for every build.

See https://reproducible-builds.org/ for why this matters.

Similar to previous commit e1d730c2ad95559cb6a0948cf8e99b4eb6eca2c2

Change-Id: Ic0e81412cf0ba3f029bc2f8be52ffdf1ba210b7b

Drop compatibility for el6

... because it's now really old, and we don't expect any users
use it to run OpenStack.

commit_message:
'tripleo_ovs_dpdk_lcore_list' should be optional

This parameter should be optional as only the first core in the mask
will be used to repin all ovs-vswitchd threads.
Leaving this parameter blank (and as a consequence, not setting
'dpdk-lcore-mask') allows all non-dpdk threads to float on the original
cpu set.

Change-Id: Ia9e001e2b1987f00a960cdf106eaa8e84dc4d71a
Signed-off-by: Christophe Fontaine <cfontain@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-23 13:01:17.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce weights for created pools to avoid ERANGE error

The current weights provided when creating pools will end up
consuming more PGs than there are room for in smaller clusters.
Starting with Ceph Octopus this will become an error and Ceph
will refuse to create all the pools.

Change-Id: I51a44b2cb60932acfa7e151d3b784c9d649efffa
Partial-Bug: #1868387
'}]
commit_message:
Reduce weights for created pools to avoid ERANGE error

The current weights provided when creating pools will end up
consuming more PGs than there are room for in smaller clusters.
Starting with Ceph Octopus this will become an error and Ceph
will refuse to create all the pools.

Change-Id: I51a44b2cb60932acfa7e151d3b784c9d649efffa
Partial-Bug: #1868387

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 05:41:19.000000000', 'message': "Pass the actual target in migrations policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for list migrations policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system scoped rather
than project, so the token scope check deals with the required
target checking.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I5f1ed2830304468ca99690cc42ba7a5d50d0b4f7
"}, {'created': '2020-03-31 07:54:49.000000000', 'message': "Pass the actual target in migrations policy

This commit pass the actual target for list migrations policies

Change-Id: I5f1ed2830304468ca99690cc42ba7a5d50d0b4f7
"}]
commit_message:
Pass the actual target in migrations policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for list migrations policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system scoped rather
than project, so the token scope check deals with the required
target checking.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I5f1ed2830304468ca99690cc42ba7a5d50d0b4f7

commit_message:
Update docs about python-systemd pkg

The package has been renamed in order to avoid the namespace collision
with systemd, update our doc accordingly.

Change-Id: I1b9a434d9bb6a7d9dc38ef965017ed9f8773d595
Closes-Bug: 1825949

commit_message:
Hacking: Fix E741

E741 ambiguous variable name 'l'

Also fix other problems found by hacking in files touched.

Change-Id: I8171994716092ae7f12018861e95ed52fee57b18

commit_message:
Allow specifying target devices for software RAID

This change adds support for the physical_disks RAID parameter in
a form of device hints (same as for root device selection).

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/713209
Change-Id: I9751ab0f86ada41e3b668670dc112d58093b8099
Story: #2006369
Task: #36153

Move ListRolesAction functionality to utils

This moves ListRolesAction functionality to utils and also
adds a flag to filter only valid roles.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 08:23:58.000000000', 'message': 'mysql: allow specifying the authentication method

MySQL users can be configured to require a specific authentication
method when connecting to the MySQL server, e.g. GSSAPI, SHA-256
or ed25519.

Expose a new attribute $plugin, that is passed to puppetlabs-mysql
When creating/updating a user in the MySQL database.

Change-Id: I1c7b40d110190eba861ed466d2644c2f1abbf7b0
Related-Bug: #1866093
(cherry picked from commit 35849bee52ee593c7c46847020e9b2bed52b1210)
'}]
commit_message:
mysql: allow specifying the authentication method

MySQL users can be configured to require a specific authentication
method when connecting to the MySQL server, e.g. GSSAPI, SHA-256
or ed25519.

Expose a new attribute $plugin, that is passed to puppetlabs-mysql
When creating/updating a user in the MySQL database.

Change-Id: I1c7b40d110190eba861ed466d2644c2f1abbf7b0
Related-Bug: #1866093
(cherry picked from commit 35849bee52ee593c7c46847020e9b2bed52b1210)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-06 19:06:35.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add a custom filter for parsing instance metadata

TripleO's TLS implementation using nova in the undercloud relies on
instance metadata that contains the services a particular instance is
going to host. For example, metadata for a controller (e.g.,
controller-0) will contain JSON that describes the services and
interfaces that are supposed to be hosted on controller (e.g.,
haproxy/controller-0.ctlplane.example.test).

For TLS, we need to generate certificates for those services
automatically. This requires us to parse the metadata for the instance,
determine the services that are supposed to the hosted by that
instance, and then curate unique principals that we add to FreeIPA.
Once the appropriate hosts (e.g., controller-0.example.test), sub-hosts
(e.g., controller-0.ctlplane.example.test), and principals (e.g.,
haproxy/controller-0.ctlplane.example.test) have been added to FreeIPA,
we can generate certificates for that service and configure it to use
TLS.

The commit attempts to introduce a filter that parses metadata from the
instance and returns a list of tuples to the caller. Each tuple is
unique to each service being hosted on an instance and we use them to
generate the requisite entities in FreeIPA for TLS certificates using
ansible-freeipa later.

The functionality was formally a part of novajoin, which is a nova
metadata service.

Change-Id: Ibbac29a9d2570280cad0f426ad0b0367587bfee7
"}, {'created': '2020-03-09 19:42:58.000000000', 'message': "Add a custom filter for parsing instance metadata

controller-0) will contain JSON that describes the services and
interfaces that are supposed to be hosted on controller (e.g.,
haproxy/controller-0.ctlplane.example.test).

For TLS, we need to generate certificates for those services
automatically. This requires us to parse the metadata for the instance,
determine the services that are supposed to the hosted by that
instance, and then curate unique principals that we add to FreeIPA.
Once the appropriate hosts (e.g., controller-0.example.test), sub-hosts
(e.g., controller-0.ctlplane.example.test), and principals (e.g.,
haproxy/controller-0.ctlplane.example.test) have been added to FreeIPA,
we can generate certificates for that service and configure it to use
TLS.

The commit attempts to introduce a filter that parses metadata from the
instance and returns a list of tuples to the caller. Each tuple is
unique to each service being hosted on an instance and we use them to
generate the requisite entities in FreeIPA for TLS certificates using
ansible-freeipa later.

The functionality was formally a part of novajoin, which is a nova
metadata service.

Change-Id: Ibbac29a9d2570280cad0f426ad0b0367587bfee7
"}, {'created': '2020-03-10 15:39:35.000000000', 'message': "Add a custom filter for parsing instance metadata

automatically. This requires us to parse the metadata for the instance,
determine the services that are supposed to the hosted by that
instance, and then curate unique principals that we add to FreeIPA.
Once the appropriate hosts (e.g., controller-0.example.test), sub-hosts
(e.g., controller-0.ctlplane.example.test), and principals (e.g.,
haproxy/controller-0.ctlplane.example.test) have been added to FreeIPA,
we can generate certificates for that service and configure it to use
TLS.

The commit attempts to introduce a filter that parses metadata from the
instance and returns a list of tuples to the caller. Each tuple is
unique to each service being hosted on an instance and we use them to
generate the requisite entities in FreeIPA for TLS certificates using
ansible-freeipa later.

The functionality was formally a part of novajoin, which is a nova
metadata service.

Change-Id: Ibbac29a9d2570280cad0f426ad0b0367587bfee7

commit_message:
Add a custom filter for parsing instance metadata

TripleO's TLS implementation using nova in the undercloud relies on
instance metadata that contains the services a particular instance is
going to host. For example, metadata for a controller (e.g.,
controller-0) will contain JSON that describes the services and
interfaces that are supposed to be hosted on controller (e.g.,
haproxy/controller-0.ctlplane.example.test).

For TLS, we need to generate certificates for those services
automatically. This requires us to parse the metadata for the instance,
determine the services that are supposed to the hosted by that
instance, and then curate unique principals that we add to FreeIPA.
Once the appropriate hosts (e.g., controller-0.example.test), sub-hosts
(e.g., controller-0.ctlplane.example.test), and principals (e.g.,
haproxy/controller-0.ctlplane.example.test) have been added to FreeIPA,
we can generate certificates for that service and configure it to use
TLS.

The commit attempts to introduce a filter that parses metadata from the
instance and returns a list of tuples to the caller. Each tuple is
unique to each service being hosted on an instance and we use them to
generate the requisite entities in FreeIPA for TLS certificates using
ansible-freeipa later.

The functionality was formally a part of novajoin, which is a nova
metadata service.

Change-Id: Ibbac29a9d2570280cad0f426ad0b0367587bfee7

pythonn-novajoin.

commit_message:
[stable-only] Cap stestr for python 2

stestr dropped python 2 support with version 3.0.0 and ceilometer does
not use constraints from openstack/requirements. test-requirements.txt
is updated to use stestr<3.0.0 in case of python 2.

Change-Id: Ic313c4566904e7470d845263d7cfdb4c9ee98690
(cherry picked from commit 25d057f4b69e8c9d57ce1f1915c094f3891a233f)

commit_message:
Stop testing python 2 in tox.

Remove python 2 from envlist parameter. Check the link:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

The plan is drop the python 2 support from OpenStack in Ussuri release.
Move the basepython parameter.

Change-Id: I52b974f7c701c8a46001a29bdf5f7b077f898cba

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 3.0.0

The new version enables a lot of standard flake8 checks, so a few
fixes are required. W503 is disabled as it conflicts with W504
and the latter seems to be preferred nowadays.

Change-Id: Ic1efc86ec41daf6fadb4cebb8a73b4dd158f880a

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-17 10:47:36.000000000', 'message': "Do not write [fwaas] in neutron.conf for Debian

Starting with Rocky, the Debian Neutron package creates a folder
/etc/neutron/server.conf.d. This folder is used as a parameter when
starting neutron-api and neutron-rpc-server using:
--config-dir=/etc/neutron/server.conf.d

When a plugin package (such as python3-neutron-fwaas) is installed,
then a symlink to the plugin configuration file (for FWAAS, this is
/etc/neutron/neutron_fwaas.conf) is dropped into server.conf.d. As
a consequence, there's no need to repeate the [fwaas] directives
into neutron.conf, as the servers will hapilly automatically load
what's in neutron_fwaas.conf.

Therefore, this package removes adding [fwaas] directives in the
neutron.conf, as this is now duplicate directives.

Change-Id: I254edd6b85fe24c6c310794d287c8e73dd7dbaf4
"}]
commit_message:
Do not write [fwaas] in neutron.conf for Debian

Starting with Rocky, the Debian Neutron package creates a folder
/etc/neutron/server.conf.d. This folder is used as a parameter when
starting neutron-api and neutron-rpc-server using:
--config-dir=/etc/neutron/server.conf.d

When a plugin package (such as python3-neutron-fwaas) is installed,
then a symlink to the plugin configuration file (for FWAAS, this is
/etc/neutron/neutron_fwaas.conf) is dropped into server.conf.d. As
a consequence, there's no need to repeate the [fwaas] directives
into neutron.conf, as the servers will hapilly automatically load
what's in neutron_fwaas.conf.

Therefore, this package removes adding [fwaas] directives in the
neutron.conf, as this is now duplicate directives.

Change-Id: I254edd6b85fe24c6c310794d287c8e73dd7dbaf4

commit_message:
Add support to deploy zun

This patch adds zun to the integrated repo, so that deployers
were able to use it out of the box and we have integrated tests

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/692406
Change-Id: I7785964668679d3f97a36daa83043f6c10a3d7ac

- pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered http://52.27.155.124/44/631244/46/check/pmem-tempest-plugin-filtered/0db043a/ : SUCCESS in 33m 53s'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-11-25 19:27:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 46: Code-Review-1

(11 comments)

I have serious concerns over the changes in compute manager. The comment in the code makes it sound like the binding isn't the heavy lifting of programming the device. If it is, the comment needs to change, but also the handling in the code needs to be vastly different, IMHO.

If that is in fact the programming step, I think we'll need to come up with a better way to kick off that process and then block in the virt driver until it's done. Wrapping the entirety of the build_resources setup in that handler is not reasonable, IMHO.

Also, as far as I can tell none of the code added here is tested other than the straight up happy path."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2019-11-26 19:11:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 46:

'}, {'created': '2019-02-22 03:51:26.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Create and bind Cyborg ARQs.

Call Cyborg with device profile name to get ARQs (Accelerator Requests).
   Each ARQ corresponds to a single device profile group, which
   corrresponds to a single request group in request spec.
Match each ARQ to associated request group, and thereby obtain the
   corresponding RP for that ARQ.
Call Cyborg to bind the ARQ to that host/device-RP.

Match each ARQ to associated request group, and thereby obtain the
   corresponding RP for that ARQ.
Call Cyborg to bind the ARQ to that host/device-RP.
When Cyborg sends the ARQ bind notification event, wait for that
   event with a timeout.

Contributions from Li Liu for notification events.

commit_message:
Create and bind Cyborg ARQs.

* Call Cyborg with device profile name to get ARQs (Accelerator Requests).
  Each ARQ corresponds to a single device profile group, which
  corrresponds to a single request group in request spec.
* Match each ARQ to associated request group, and thereby obtain the
  corresponding RP for that ARQ.
* Call Cyborg to bind the ARQ to that host/device-RP.
* When Cyborg sends the ARQ bind notification events, wait for those
  events with a timeout.

Change-Id: I0f8b6bf2b4f4510da6c84fede532533602b6af7f
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ibecf2ea61d75ec574123094a1783f9d664000d98

commit_message:
Add new default roles in server diagnostics policies

This adds new defaults roles in server diagnostics API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ibecf2ea61d75ec574123094a1783f9d664000d98

OVS agent runs on SmartNIC and delegates port plug/unplug to os-vif.
logic that properly deals with removed ports is missing.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2020-01-19 07:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2020-01-20 14:45:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25241, 'date': '2020-01-21 12:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So sean, according to this spec [1], in smart nics case, the ovs agent is responsible for processing the ports and do plug/unplug in os-vif
for that spec we have the logic to add the ports and miss the part for removing them, so this patch is handling that
[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-specs/blob/master/specs/stein/neutron-ovs-agent-support-baremetal-with-smart-nic.rst'}, {'account_id': 11604, 'date': '2020-01-21 23:13:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2020-01-22 09:30:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Can you elaborate what you have in mind?

An RFE could be filed and discussed in ML/Driver meeting/PTG
if we end up with a better model im all for it but until then i dont think it should block what this patch is trying to fix.

IIRC there where lengthy discussions with both ironic and neutron community about the approach.'}, {'account_id': 28714, 'date': '2020-01-22 09:31:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 07:02:22.000000000', 'message': '[Follow Up] Add support for Smart NICs

This change enhances removing smartnic ports:
  * When deleting SmartNic port,
    it will remove the unbound ports from integration bridge
  * When sync deleted SmartNic ports on Neutron OVS agent restart,
    it will remove the port from integration bridge not mapped to
    neutron SmartNic ports.

Change-Id: I7077577cca54329fbcb77fbde730389835ab6497

    neutron SmartNic ports.

'}, {'created': '2020-02-25 06:44:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Removing SmartNIC OVS representor port on instance tear down and resync

The current flow where a port is unbound from an agent running on
smartnic was not implemented causing representor ports to remain
connected to the integration bridge.
This change solves this issue in two cases:
  * When deleting the instance and so deleting SmartNic port,
    it will remove the unbound ports from integration bridge
  * When resync SmartNic ports on Neutron OVS agent restart,
    it will remove the port from integration bridge not mapped to
    neutron SmartNic ports.

Closes-Bug: #1855260
Change-Id: I7077577cca54329fbcb77fbde730389835ab6497
'}, {'created': '2020-02-26 13:47:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix: Removing SmartNIC OVS representor port on instance tear down and resync

    neutron SmartNic ports.

Change-Id: I7077577cca54329fbcb77fbde730389835ab6497

commit_message:
Neutron ovs agent: Removing SmartNIC OVS representor port on instance tear down and resync

The current flow where a port is unbound from an agent running on
smartnic was not implemented causing representor ports to remain
connected to the integration bridge.
This change solves this issue in two cases:
  * When deleting the instance and so deleting SmartNic port,
    it will remove the unbound ports from integration bridge
  * When resync SmartNic ports on Neutron OVS agent restart,
    it will remove the port from integration bridge not mapped to
    neutron SmartNic ports.

Closes-Bug: #1855260
Change-Id: I7077577cca54329fbcb77fbde730389835ab6497

commit_message:
Fix assertEqual param order in Accelerator tests

To have a correct error message in case of failure the proper order
of parameters are:

    self.assertEqual(expected, actual)

Change-Id: Ia0e909c6ed19f0fd49aa3aa5f5f7a9ea987d9080

commit_message:
Add new default roles in migrations policies

This adds new defaults roles in list migration API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_READER role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I45acb44c6eac5e9cae2b13c89ceb86afc348fcbe

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in list migrations

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for list migrations API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I7332821b10305fff9e6a45006027c978d0bcefe7

subject: Fix serialization of structures that might contain YAQL types

This is a bit modified version of https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714416/ that doesn't have handling for generators. This is because we can't use the newer version of oslo.serialization (2.21.1) that contains the parameter "fallback" in the method "jsonutils.to_primitive".'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2020-04-01 05:41:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19134, 'date': '2020-04-01 09:14:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 05:34:08.000000000', 'message': 'Fix serialization of structures that might contain YAQL types

* When YAQL output data conversion is disabled there's still
  an issue caused by presence of not JSON-compatible types within
  a YAQL result. The internal Mistral code is already able to deal
  with that (due to the previous changes) by checking that and
  converting them to what's needed. However, JSON serialization
  may still not work if it's done via the standard "json" library.
  The library simply doesn't handle those non-standard types and
  raises an exception. We have a sanitizing function that all YAQL
  results go through, however, it doesn't make sense to do recursive
  sanitizing for performance reasons. It does make sense to convert
  data as late as possible to avoid redundant data manipulations. So
  the sanitizing function handles only the root object in the object
  graph. The solution for this problem is to use our own utility
  function based on the "oslo_serialization.jsonutils" that is able
  to deal with at least part of the mentioned types, specifically
  FrozenDict and iterators.

  serialization, including the action "std.http".
* Added necessary unit tests.

'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 05:41:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix serialization of structures that might contain YAQL types

* When YAQL output data conversion is disabled there's still
  an issue caused by presence of not JSON-compatible types within
  a YAQL result. The internal Mistral code is already able to deal
  with that (due to the previous changes) by checking that and
  converting them to what's needed. However, JSON serialization
  may still not work if it's done via the standard "json" library.
  The library simply doesn't handle those non-standard types and
  raises an exception. We have a sanitizing function that all YAQL
  results go through, however, it doesn't make sense to do recursive
  sanitizing for performance reasons. It does make sense to convert
  data as late as possible to avoid redundant data manipulations. So
  the sanitizing function handles only the root object in the object
  graph. The solution for this problem is to use our own utility
  function based on the "oslo_serialization.jsonutils" that is able
  to deal with at least part of the mentioned types, specifically
  FrozenDict and iterators.

commit_message:
Fix serialization of structures that might contain YAQL types

* When YAQL output data conversion is disabled there's still
  an issue caused by presence of not JSON-compatible types within
  a YAQL result. The internal Mistral code is already able to deal
  with that (due to the previous changes) by checking that and
  converting them to what's needed. However, JSON serialization
  may still not work if it's done via the standard "json" library.
  The library simply doesn't handle those non-standard types and
  raises an exception. We have a sanitizing function that all YAQL
  results go through, however, it doesn't make sense to do recursive
  sanitizing for performance reasons. It does make sense to convert
  data as late as possible to avoid redundant data manipulations. So
  the sanitizing function handles only the root object in the object
  graph. The solution for this problem is to use our own utility
  function based on the "oslo_serialization.jsonutils" that is able
  to deal with at least part of the mentioned types, specifically
  FrozenDict and iterators.
* Used the new function "utils.to_json_str()" everywhere for JSON
  serialization, including the action "std.http".
* Added necessary unit tests.


Closes-Bug: #1869168
Depends-On: I1081a44a6f305eb1dfe68a5bad30110385130725
Change-Id: I9e73ea7cbba215c3e1d174b5189be27c640c4d42

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-13 18:16:59.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure veth pairs are uniquely named

We name veth pairs using up to the first 6 characters from the nodes names. If
the node name prefixes are longer than this then the node index will not be
included, and the interface names will not be unique.

e.g. prefix compute, 2 nodes: compute0 & compute1

Link names are all p-comput-0-tap

Note that the 0 here is the index of the physnet, node the node.

This patch includes any trailing digits to keep link names unique, e.g.
p-compu0-0-tap.

Change-Id: I35c3da1d00030d8a270ac1a09e88e22098594f20
Story: 2007431
Task: 39058

commit_message:
Ensure veth pairs are uniquely named

We name veth pairs using up to the first 6 characters from the nodes names. If
the node name prefixes are longer than this then the node index will not be
included, and the interface names will not be unique.

e.g. prefix compute, 2 nodes: compute0 & compute1

Link names are all p-comput-0-tap

Note that the 0 here is the index of the physnet, node the node.

This patch includes any trailing digits to keep link names unique, e.g.
p-compu0-0-tap.

Change-Id: I35c3da1d00030d8a270ac1a09e88e22098594f20
Story: 2007431
Task: 39058

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 17:46:58.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic1a64160ecef5ec94837121849cba7087691c93f
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ic1a64160ecef5ec94837121849cba7087691c93f

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Id29ada736f77a93b60ade62b9032e762af22987e
Sem-Ver: feature

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 18:10:35.000000000', 'message': "Replace incident channel with opendev-meeting

The openstack-infra-incident channel has traditionally (though
infrequently) been used as a venue for focusing on specific tasks
during emergency incidents, so that conversation doesn't get muddied
by other discussions occurring in the general channel. The OpenDev
collaborators are also in need of a brand-neutral channel where we
can conduct recurring IRC meetings, instead of continuing to rely on
the openstack-meeting channel. The two needs are actually similar,
and also incidents and meeting conversation will tend to not occur
at the same exact time (because if there's an incident underway
we'll be postponing the meeting, or actually meeting around the
incident, depending on how you look at it).

Change-Id: I56663ad0de2db297956c8a9ad36b005b52d20065
"}]
commit_message:
Replace incident channel with opendev-meeting

The openstack-infra-incident channel has traditionally (though
infrequently) been used as a venue for focusing on specific tasks
during emergency incidents, so that conversation doesn't get muddied
by other discussions occurring in the general channel. The OpenDev
collaborators are also in need of a brand-neutral channel where we
can conduct recurring IRC meetings, instead of continuing to rely on
the openstack-meeting channel. The two needs are actually similar,
and also incidents and meeting conversation will tend to not occur
at the same exact time (because if there's an incident underway
we'll be postponing the meeting, or actually meeting around the
incident, depending on how you look at it).

Change-Id: I56663ad0de2db297956c8a9ad36b005b52d20065

commit_message:
Add dynamic concurrency values

This change computes the concurrency values against the execution workload
allow the playbook to adjust the concurrency value to whatever the user has
defined when that value makes sense. If the concurrency value is greater
than the expected workload the value will be adjusted down as needed. While
this change is not 100% required it will ensure that the execution of our
playbooks is more programatically efficient.

Change-Id: I368187f142560108fe66a59f9acc2d9a6fac97d3
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add basic parameter update playbook

This change adds a simple update parameter playbook which will take the place
of the tripleo-common UpdateParametersAction class functionality within
tripleoclient.

Story: 2007212
Task: 39045

Change-Id: I3d1c736f6d1ee704ece0101134f95582a5d060eb
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 00:57:46.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in server diagnostics

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server diagnostics API policies
as 'system' and 'project' but we will keep default as SYSTEM_ADMIN only.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ie1749d4f85b8bdc4110f57c9a33e54e9551cb7e3
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in server diagnostics

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for server diagnostics API policies
as 'system' and 'project' but we will keep default as SYSTEM_ADMIN only.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ie1749d4f85b8bdc4110f57c9a33e54e9551cb7e3

commit_message:
Expose --limit, --skip-tags, and --tags in config-download.

The Mistral workflows can now consume these ansible-playbook arguments
and using them during config-download (during the deploy and update
only). Separate arguments align with the new Ansible Runner which cannot
accept any arbitrary or random argument.

Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibb3feb21a276c52b68f61e9dcb739de14bb111cd

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 00:37:46.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing server diagnostics policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server
diagnostics policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I98faf703fea615d553700dd3c151c044fbc46821
'}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing server diagnostics policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing server
diagnostics policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I98faf703fea615d553700dd3c151c044fbc46821

commit_message:
Fluentd: Switch to Native Metrics Plugin

This change updates the fluentd chart to use the native
fluent-plugin-prometheus for metric production. This plugin
provides more detailed metrics about fluentd's operations,
specifically regarding input and output statistics.

https://github.com/fluent/fluent-plugin-prometheus

Using the plugin, each fluentd pod produces metrics, so
scape annotations have been added to the pod spec. The
zuul check on metric producers has been updated to account
for this.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/714167
Change-Id: I809356d92b0cff1e31cb2062102bbedefd4843fd

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Update hacking extension for newer flake8. Remove vi header check, this
is enabled as H106 already.

Fix problems found.

Change-Id: Ie4ccf0a1075995f5624a838388b6b0b46343129a

commit_message:
Fix selinux denial on centos8/rhel8 when relabelling /var/lib/nova

Id5503ed274bd5dc0c5365cc994de7e5cdcbc2fb6 is failing with permission
denied on rhel8 due to a selinux denial.

Change-Id: If7a565cdb14282261125d4e32488bb9c5ebc504e
Related-bug: #1869020

commit_message:
ovn_dbs_virtual_ip created even though ovn is disabled

When ML2/OVS is used instead of OVN, also neuter
OS::TripleO::Network::Ports::OVNDBsVipPort to avoid wasting
an IP address.

Closes-Bug: #1869900
Change-Id: Ib87b9b2951c70cb3301014a8015929fabcdeefb6

commit_message:
Expect python3 package in CentOS8

In CentOS, we expect to have python3 package in 8.x while we expect to
have python2 in 7.x .
Fix unit tests to expect the correct version according to os major
version.

Incorrect version handling about libreswan/openswan package is also
fixed so that we have correct one in CentOS8.

In addition, this patch updates test scope in tempest execution in
tripleo job to avoid timeout error caused by many long-running tests.

Closes-Bug: #1870257
Change-Id: I72302b58161edccb15ca008e11c670caaf94edaf

commit_message:
Install python-openstackclient using upper constraints

Detect current branch from .gitreview and use upper constraints to
install python-openstackclient, to guarantee compatibility with the
Python version in use.

commit_message:
Enable Apparmor to Cinder

Co-Authored by gage Hugo <gagehugo@gmail.com>.

This Patchset creates Zuul Gate Jobs for apparmor to support Cinder.

commit_message:
Propagate mtu to all subnets

In networking-ovn we map subnets to OVN DHCP_Options
rows (where we store the MTU), but from neutron API perspective,
the MTU is applied per network. So we need update all subnets
thats belong to network to propagade correctly MTU for network.

Closes-Bug: #1816449
Change-Id: Ieddc16e607bccef84316f9ee908e884539c7ed39
(cherry picked from commit 87ecdd8e0b3a7564ac9bc003debe0afad0782f46)
(cherry picked from commit 017c49ecd59a0173e6cbdbeb874a8673b38e46b4)

commit_message:
CI: increase the swift loopback disk size for the CentOS job

The default size for the swift backend disk is just 2G, we're very
close to running out of space there. Use 4G instead.

Change-Id: If3247aa1d207e0a918e0fcb745f8d78adbfb16e2
(cherry picked from commit f689cfaf93f2b4124ef61872ae11e18cf4a8d888)

[{'created': '2020-04-02 10:52:37.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I225987c2124f046e29eb542de5c11c07716bec25
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I225987c2124f046e29eb542de5c11c07716bec25

[{'created': '2020-04-01 05:32:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add new default roles in remote console policies

This adds new defaults roles in remote console  API policies.
- lock/unlock policies are default to system admin or project member.
- unlock server locked by other is system admin.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic81da0ebc23d6526c5ca2d9d98159e07f3e53822

commit_message:
Add new default roles in remote console policies

This adds new defaults roles in remote console  API policies.
- lock/unlock policies are default to system admin or project member.
- unlock server locked by other is system admin.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ic81da0ebc23d6526c5ca2d9d98159e07f3e53822

commit_message:
Combine the limits policies in single place

limits and used_limits extensions were megred in
- I76e02214e958a55b6de8033243b46b259949e5ac

But policy were left in separate file. limits policy
is in policies/limits which is general policy to get the
limit of project. used_limit is in polocies/used_limit
which is enforced in view builder for gettting the limit
of other project.

This commit:
- move used_limit in policies/limit file
- move the used_limit policy enforcement from view buidler to limit API controller.
- adjust the tests due to above changes.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Iefe41cc95cd967b368588dea5ff195bb4af3eca7

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: Iebf804d227f950ad9b7f5d589c6682a99c595370
Sem-Ver: feature

 > I am checking what are the minimal sufficient security groups.

When network traffic is not encapsulated, all traffic must be open from workers to master nodes.
For example, in my example DS, to curl HTTP from worker to master port 80 protocol TCP must be allowed.

I am not sure if you (CERN does not have security groups) want traffic from workers to masters to be open.
If conformance passes it should be ok."}, {'account_id': 28022, 'date': '2020-03-26 14:18:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
CI: increase the swift loopback disk size for the CentOS job

The default size for the swift backend disk is just 2G, we're very
close to running out of space there. Use 4G instead.

Change-Id: If3247aa1d207e0a918e0fcb745f8d78adbfb16e2

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I792a17f4b2667713503e6bc10cfabed9905d8535

[{'created': '2020-02-03 20:22:20.000000000', 'message': "tests: work around malformed serial XML

The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They are
only enough to pass existing unit tests, but are not future-proof, and
would not work with something like migration._update_serial_xml(). In
addition, two of them (type=file and type=pty) are not actually used by
anything.

This patch removes the unused types and starts checking the
CONF.serial_console.enabled flag before including any serial XML in
the fake domain. This allows tests that don't set serial_console =
enabled (like the subsequent NUMA LM func test) to not have to deal
with the broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it in the past
now just set serial_console = enabled.

Change-Id: Ie74fcd689a627c178f80ec60df2dfef40576f182

commit_message:
tests: work around malformed serial XML

The serial elements in fakelibvirt's XMLDesc() are malformed. They are
only enough to pass existing unit tests, but are not future-proof, and
would not work with something like migration._update_serial_xml(). In
addition, two of them (type=file and type=pty) are not actually used by
anything.

This patch removes the unused types and starts checking the
CONF.serial_console.enabled flag before including any serial XML in
the fake domain. This allows tests that don't set
serial_console_enabled (like the subsequent NUMA LM func test) to not
have to deal with the broken serial XML, while tests that relied on it
in the past now just set serial_console_enabled = True.

Change-Id: Ie74fcd689a627c178f80ec60df2dfef40576f182

There are two almost identical implementations of the _run_periodics()
helper - and a third one would have joined them in a subsequent patch,
if not for this patch. This patch moves the _run_periodics() to the
base test class. In addition, _run_periodics() depends on the
self.computes dict used for compute service tracking. The method that
populates that dict, _start_compute(), is therefore also moved to the
base class.

This enables some light refactoring of existing tests that need
either the _run_periodics() helper, or the compute service tracking.

In addition, a needless override of _start_compute() in
test_aggregates that provided no added value is removed. This is done
to avoid any potential confusion around _start_compute()'s role.

Change-Id: I36dd64dc272ea1743995b3b696323a9431666489

commit_message:
func tests: move _run_periodics() into base class

There are two almost identical implementations of the _run_periodics()
helper - and a third one would have joined them in a subsequent patch,
if not for this patch. This patch moves the _run_periodics() to the
base test class. In addition, _run_periodics() depends on the
self.computes dict used for compute service tracking. The method that
populates that dict, _start_compute(), is therefore also moved to the
base class.

This enables some light refactoring of existing tests that need
either the _run_periodics() helper, or the compute service tracking.

In addition, a needless override of _start_compute() in
test_aggregates that provided no added value is removed. This is done
to avoid any potential confusion around _start_compute()'s role.

Change-Id: I36dd64dc272ea1743995b3b696323a9431666489

safdasdf

Change-Id: I33d8ac0a1cae0b2d275a21287d5e44c008a68122

To make configs more readable it's worth dropping out commented out
lines. Also some issues in configs has been fixed.

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I220563d4d84fec1fba501cd80887b03e43b4c020

commit_message:
Release final os-client-config for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I3d4678bdb3b02a70e2c136c7f7fbc4513a085bff
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Set Rocky status to Extended Maintenance

Project's last releases in Rocky have been tagged with rocky-em,
so let's move Rocky to Extendended Maintenance phase.

Change-Id: I9fbccb70dbb77bbe4ad2dec42dceb09306bf587d

commit_message:
Drop compatibility for el6

... because it's now really old, and we don't expect any users
use it to run OpenStack.

commit_message:
Update python-charm-jobs template description

python-charm-jobs template is for py2.7 testing which
was used by various charm repos and they stable branch.

Those repo moved to py3 template but stable branch still
need to keep using the py2 template so let's update the
description of this template.

Change-Id: Ic17ec65b2229d46b799e0c41824e6e368723098b

commit_message:
Support linux bridge in addition to OVS

While OVS was used initially due to availability of a
networking-generic-switch driver for it, Linux bridge can be useful for
environments where OVS is not available.

This is configured via bridge_type variable. It defaults to
'openvswitch', but may be set to 'linuxbridge'.

Change-Id: I750a73cebc743edcbcd8c23c67e4920d0058bead

commit_message:
Release final ovsdbapp for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I886aa583a5b38f498596f0b7fd3ac25a58ac75a5
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 11:03:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix node scheduling with pipe in hostvars

If Ansible hostvars contain a pipe (|) character, this can cause
problems during scheduling as Ansible fails during Jinja templating.
This is probably a bug in Ansible/Jinja.

The particular case where this was hit was when using screen, the
TERMCAP environment variable gets set to something beginning with
'SC|screen|VT'.

This change addresses the issue by moving the capture of hostvars inside
the tenks_update_state action plugin rather than evaluating them in a
playbook.

Change-Id: Ibef91d9ef499c8741b61a170672a23f530a600bb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix node scheduling with pipe in hostvars

If Ansible hostvars contain a pipe (|) character, this can cause
problems during scheduling as Ansible fails during Jinja templating.
This is probably a bug in Ansible/Jinja.

The particular case where this was hit was when using screen, the
TERMCAP environment variable gets set to something beginning with
'SC|screen|VT'.

This change addresses the issue by moving the capture of hostvars inside
the tenks_update_state action plugin rather than evaluating them in a
playbook.

Change-Id: Ibef91d9ef499c8741b61a170672a23f530a600bb

Build succeeded.

- kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi http://52.3.254.104/17/711217/1/check/kaminario-dsvm-tempest-full-iscsi/a1129d4 : SUCCESS in 2h 27m 22s'}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2020-03-25 17:11:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-30 19:57:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2020-04-02 12:21:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Only thing I would say is these types of checks during driver creation should be done during do_setup() time, or check_for_setup_error,
that way the volume manager has a chance to create the driver object, and then proceed with it's normal startup.

The volume manager sets up lots of stuff that can help debug issues with drivers and backends in it's __init__ phase, but will stop all of that if the driver fails it's __init__ phase.  If you delay these kinds of checks to driver do_setup() time, then it will be easier to debug issues for deployers."}, {'account_id': 12670, 'date': '2020-04-02 12:45:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Walter, yes this and other info gathering methods would be better served in do_setup.  If it is Ok by you, we will do this in a separate review, so we can cover all scenario's, not just this one."}, {'account_id': 5997, 'date': '2020-04-02 14:24:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

Approving this now with the understanding that there will be a follow up to move the testing of the config into driver.do_setup() time, instead of driver.__init__() time.'}]

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Replication array serial check

Add a check during common.py __init__ to compare
serial numbers of local and remote replication arrays
to prevent the user from defining the same array
for both R1 and R2 sides.

Change-Id: I83a712c739c315422e157f91cad1b87c01fb9cbc

[{'created': '2020-03-28 17:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix loading of Monasca Grafana dashboards

This is a minimal fix to support loading dashboards into the Monasca
Grafana fork. It firstly aligns the default Monasca Grafana control plane
organisation with Kolla Ansible to make the feature easier to use.
Secondly, it extracts the associated OpenStack project name from this
variable by stripping off the OpenStack domain.

Longer term we may wish to move the dashboard loading functionality
into Kolla Ansible, now that it supports deploying Monasca.

Affects Rocky onwards.

commit_message:
Fix loading of Monasca Grafana dashboards

This is a minimal fix to support loading dashboards into the Monasca
Grafana fork. It firstly aligns the default Monasca Grafana control
plane organisation and Monasca Grafana local admin username with Kolla
Ansible to make the feature easier to use. Secondly, it extracts the
associated OpenStack project name from this variable by stripping off
the OpenStack domain.

Longer term we may wish to move the dashboard loading functionality into
Kolla Ansible, now that it supports deploying Monasca.

Affects Rocky onwards.

Change-Id: I77c94edf654565a12ce8be681e3c9b16caa55c86
Story: 2007477
Task: 39186

commit_message:
Introduce 'pcpuset' field for InstanceNUMACell

Introduce the 'pcpuset' to InstanceNUMACell object for tracking
the dedicated instance CPUs. And and current 'cpuset' field is
assinged a specific role of tracking the instance virtual node
shared CPUs.

This patch is based on https://review.opendev.org/714707 and
https://review.opendev.org/714705.

Part of blueprint use-pcpu-and-vcpu-in-one-instance

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Wang Huaqiang <huaqiang.wang@intel.com>

Change-Id: I901fbd7df00e45196395ff4c69e7b8aa3359edf6

WIP - add flow to clean up IPA on stack delete

This will add the invocation of an ansible script to clean up
FreeIPA when a stack is deleted.

Change-Id: I2470b818f3fbc5c36ca891c5814fc7ff20ec9465

subject: Setting Python version explicitly to 3 for devstack jobs
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 08:49:48.000000000', 'message': 'Setting Python version explicitly to 3 for devstack jobs

* Backports to stable/train are now failing because tempest requires
  Py3 but for some reason Py2 is provided. So we have to explicitly
  define the version of Python in master because there are no
  stable branches for tempest.

Change-Id: I19b57e686306b9d3f26bc5a0228ebf5d7c08bb20
'}]
commit_message:
Setting Python version explicitly to 3 for devstack jobs

* Backports to stable/train are now failing because tempest requires
  Py3 but for some reason Py2 is provided. So we have to explicitly
  define the version of Python in master because there are no
  stable branches for tempest.

Change-Id: I19b57e686306b9d3f26bc5a0228ebf5d7c08bb20

commit_message:
Add code to register nodes as ipa-clients

This code replaces the server ipaclient-baremetal-ansible by using
a role from freeipa-ansible to register the nodes (controllers,
computes) as ipa-clients.

In external_tasks, the host entry is created and an otp is stored
as a host variable.  In deploy_step_tasks, this otp is used to
register the node.

This change depends on the corresponding change in triple-ansible as
well as changes to make freeipa-ansible available.

Change-Id: I42397f0b5ae3cbb766dd1b65cf2590451c79dd97

'}, {'created': '2020-03-11 16:43:33.000000000', 'message': 'Add code to deregister nodes and services from freeipa

These additional tasks, given the server metadata, remove IPA services
and deregister the base host from IPA. Used during a scale down and
stack delete operations.

By invoking the tasks and script added for this commit, a deployer
can clean up all the services and subhosts for a host that is being
deleted.  This is to be invoked when the stack itself is deleted
and is like a "nuke" option.

Ultimately, we'd like to replace the python code here with ansible
calls, but only when support is added for listing services by managed
subhost in ansible-freeipa.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib08f038773f8ca28d85a95921cdb522b5cd4de04
'}, {'created': '2020-03-11 18:03:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add code to deregister nodes and services from freeipa

These additional tasks, given the server metadata, remove IPA services
and deregister the base host from IPA. Used during a scale down and
stack delete operations.

By invoking the tasks and script added for this commit, a deployer
can clean up all the services and subhosts for a host that is being
deleted.  This is to be invoked when the stack itself is deleted
and is like a "nuke" option.

Ultimately, we'd like to replace the python code here with ansible
calls, but only when support is added for listing services by managed
subhost in ansible-freeipa.

'}, {'created': '2020-03-12 17:28:42.000000000', 'message': 'Add code to deregister nodes and services from freeipa

These additional tasks, given the server metadata, remove IPA services
and deregister the base host from IPA. Used during a scale down and
stack delete operations.

By invoking the tasks and script added for this commit, a deployer
can clean up all the services and subhosts for a host that is being
deleted.  This is to be invoked when the stack itself is deleted
and is like a "nuke" option.

Ultimately, we'd like to replace the python code here with ansible
calls, but only when support is added for listing services by managed
subhost in ansible-freeipa.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib08f038773f8ca28d85a95921cdb522b5cd4de04

commit_message:
Add code to deregister nodes and services from freeipa

A module has been added to delete hosts and clean up all the sub hosts
and services associated with those hosts in IPA.  It can be called
for a single host - as in the case of a scale_down operation, or for
multiple hosts - as in the case of a stack delete.  Ultimately, we
would like to add this functionality to ansible-freeipa.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib08f038773f8ca28d85a95921cdb522b5cd4de04

commit_message:
Add playbook to clean up IPA when a stack is deleted

A playbook has been added to clean up all the hosts, subhosts
and services for a stack.  This playbook will be called in
python-tripleoclient and invoked when "openstack stack delete"
is called.

Change-Id: I7b38d3e18df9a3abbe9a1097ff6ed649e0a326e3

Emilien, can you please elaborate on your comment?

My understanding is that ansible-freeipa is the module that is non-specific to TripleO. The tripleo-ipa module reads the internal server metadata format of TripleO and adds TripleO services to IPA, which is, at least from our assumptions when creating this, very TripleO specific. Maybe you see some use case for this module which might be outside of our initial scope?

In part of this code, there are cases in which an ansible-freeipa module is not available, like adding the permissions in setup.yml, in which case we call the ipa binary directly, but it will take time to introduce those to ansible-freeipa.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-03 14:56:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 39:

'}, {'created': '2020-01-14 14:57:39.000000000', 'message': 'Add role to add ipa services for tls-everywhere

This role adds required IPA services given the server metadata
and registers the base host as an ipa client.
To be used when novajoin is not available, that is:
 * in the standalone node (to be used in TLS Everywhere CI),
 * when using pre-provisioned nodes.

This code requires the ansible-freeipa package to be installed.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie7fa5e1e83a3b015fd1e86c4666ace575e99833e

To be used when novajoin is not available, that is:
 * in the standalone node (to be used in TLS Everywhere CI),
 * when using pre-provisioned nodes.

This code requires the ansible-freeipa package to be installed.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie7fa5e1e83a3b015fd1e86c4666ace575e99833e

commit_message:
Add role to add ipa services for tls-everywhere

This role adds required IPA services given the server metadata
and registers the base host as an ipa client.
To be used when novajoin is not available, that is:
 * in the standalone node (to be used in TLS Everywhere CI),
 * when using pre-provisioned nodes.

This commit also ensure we don't attempt to register a server/host
that's already enrolled.

This code requires the ansible-freeipa package to be installed.

Co-Authored-By: Grzegorz Grasza <xek@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie7fa5e1e83a3b015fd1e86c4666ace575e99833e

Add unit tests coverage for validation, group and logs classes

Increase the unit tests coverage for recent code:
validation, group and logs classes.
(Increase of 54 unit tests)

Move per action files into one test file:
test_validation_actions

subject: Allow configuration via environment variables
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-01 16:49:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-01 18:13:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Needs more work'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-01 18:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This test [1] should append "Environment: ``RENO_RELEASE_TAG_RE``" to the expected string used on assert.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/reno/blob/master/reno/tests/test_exts.py#L124'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-01 19:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> This test [1] should append "Environment: ``RENO_RELEASE_TAG_RE``"
 > to the expected string used on assert.
 > 
 > [1] https://github.com/openstack/reno/blob/master/reno/tests/test_exts.py#L124

Sorry, I meant we need to append "Environment: ``RENO_RELEASE_TAG_RE``" to the string.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-04-02 15:42:17.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 16:49:40.000000000', 'message': "Allow configuration via environment variables

The pbr integration of reno doesn't provide an easy way to configure
reno itself. Make this possible using environment variables.

Change-Id: Ic6fe4ec404b02aee398b291a9b1430b6700aa9c6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Allow configuration via environment variables

The pbr integration of reno doesn't provide an easy way to configure
reno itself. Make this possible using environment variables.

Change-Id: Ic6fe4ec404b02aee398b291a9b1430b6700aa9c6
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

Remove python-keystonemiddleware Ubuntu Swift fix

The Swift Ubuntu packages has been updated to properly
depend on the python-keystonemiddleware package. [1]

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1815093

(cherry picked from commit b190a75b2cb9a365be39dd39db5bd4c05c1ce109)

commit_message:
Support setting Kafka storage volume

Not everyone wants Kafka data stored on a Docker volume. This
change allows a user to flexibly control where the data is stored.

Change-Id: I2ba8c7a85c7bf2564f954a43c6e6dbb3257fe902

commit_message:
Only check for partitions on devices that are part of software RAID

Now that an operator can pick the devices that participate in RAID,
it no longer makes sense to verify all devices.

Change-Id: Id5d8d539183f0db4ba3c4132ce6bc9919f9cd1ea
Story: #2006369

commit_message:
Limit scope of puppet-neutron-tripleo-standalone tempest tests

The current scope used in tempest job it so wide that it can cause
timeout in gate job continuously.
This patch limits the test scope for netowork api and basic network
ops scenario test to avoid timeout.

Closes-Bug: #1870257
Change-Id: If3b2c8a8f8c4bbb4a1391207c2ed2ae4660a9bab

remove py27 from tox.ini

Remove python 2 from envlist parameter. Check the link:

https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

The plan is drop the python 2 support from OpenStack in Ussuri release.
Move the basepython parameter.

commit_message:
Document the "immutable" resource option

Roles, projects, and domains can accept "immutable" as a resource
option. This change explains the option in the admin guide and updates
the API reference to mention it.

Change-Id: I95926927472f6418f97a08fea0ebd56da04ce7a5
Related-bug: #1823258

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not needed
to be installed at run-time.

Fix flake8wrap to take arguments from tox.ini and not look at .tox
directory.

Change-Id: I1c5f5a85af02d9f11e475b6088fe1d9d9d252083

commit_message:
Release final keystoneauth for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ie49355272ea0f175dd4a0ff5ff078977c9c7ebdd
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Release final keystonemiddleware for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Ie1e761515fb7c324d81b73970396a45654fb5043
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

Sure, always nicer to mark commits more official, On the other hand, is unofficial release means OpenStack will not allow it? Or will not push it?"}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-02-27 12:50:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> > I know that it's not a must to release merged patches (and could

 >

 > hand, is unofficial release means OpenStack will not allow it? Or
 > will not push it?

Just got my answer from #openstack-release"}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-02-27 12:59:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

> > I know that it's not a must to release merged patches (and could
 > > bring in new bugs), but it seems there are some bugfixes
 > unreleased
 > > but merged. Don't they worth a final release?
 > >
 > > See: https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/heat-stable-rocky-em
 > 
 > Sure, always nicer to mark commits more official, On the other
 > hand, is unofficial release means OpenStack will not allow it? Or
 > will not push it?

The aim of Extended Maintenance is to have a common ground where fixes can land to help each other, but since this is only a 'reasonable effort' we say that there won't be any release after the EM tag. Releases should happen downstream for branches/components in Extended Maintenance, if needed. Of course there could be exceptions, but I think that is not needed.

So what I wanted to say is that openstack/heat has merged bugfixes and if you think the same that they worth to be released as a final rocky release (11.X.X), then we should do it, and tag that release as 'rocky-em'.

About all the other repositories (heat-agents, heat-dashboard, heat-translator, python-heatclient, tosca-parser) I don't see bugfixes or anything that I think is needed to be released."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2020-02-28 08:16:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-29 05:09:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-02-29 14:26:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-02-29 14:46:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

lgtm'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2020-03-02 11:39:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)

I still think that we could release a new version from heat (only heat, since in the other components there aren't any patch that makes changes in release binary - so those hashes should match the latest released versions hash).

If that's ok, then I can prepare a release patch for heat and update plus rebase this patch on top of that."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-02 14:36:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

(1 comment)

Hashes are all wrong. Looks like Rico modified them on patchset 4. That needs to be fixed.

Rico, if you want these changes released, you need to submit a release request with the latest hash. Then this can be rebased on top of that.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:53:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-26 16:53:36.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-2 by Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
[heat] Transition Rocky to EM

This transition the rocky branch to extended maintenance.
Changes for bugfixes and things the team deems important are
still encouraged, but there will no longer be official releases
off of the branch.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this
transition, or -1 if there are any final backports currently in
flight that we should wait for. For the latter case, please
update the patch with the new commit hash after doing a final
release to get those changes out so we know to proceed with the
transition.

Change-Id: Ifc9e33a2b86918112393bcfdf28ecd5317a2c8c9
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Remove QEMU_VERSION_REQ_SHARED

The updated minimum required libvirt (4.0.0) and QEMU (2.11)
for "Ussuri" satisfy the version requirements; this was done
in Change-Id: Ia18e9be4d (22c1916b49 — libvirt: Bump
MIN_{LIBVIRT,QEMU}_VERSION for "Ussuri", 2019-11-19).

Drop the version constant  QEMU_VERSION_REQ_SHARED and now-needless
compatibility code; adjust/remove tests.

Change-Id: If878a023c69f25a9ea45b7de2ff9eb1976aaeb8c
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add old ruby support to inet6_prefix

When running an older version of Ruby that has
an old version of ipaddr this function fails with
a uninitialized constant IPAddr::AddressFamilyError
error.

This can happen if you are for example running this
code from inside a Puppetserver that runs under JRuby
that has an older version of ipaddr.

This adds a check if one of the classes that was introduced
to replace the ArgumentError exception is present and customizes
the exceptions we catch based on that.

Change-Id: I9948d4dc22195300cf1c0a48fcc0694bcf991698

[{'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-03-31 14:42:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-03-31 15:38:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

According to my script your email (the canidacy title) isn't a valid OSF membership email? Maybe double check that and push an update?"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:28:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

not sure what changed, he is returning PTL with same email id listed in governance  - https://governance.openstack.org/tc/reference/projects/barbican.html'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:33:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This can happen if he doesn't vote in any OSF board of directors elections for two years, his membership would expire and go inactive. Also possible if E-mail addresses in the OSF profile were changed to no longer match."}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:36:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not even turning up a profile when searching by name: https://www.openstack.org/community/members/results?mq=mendiz"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:40:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I'm not even turning up a profile when searching by name:
 > https://www.openstack.org/community/members/results?mq=mendiz

yeah, I also doubt some automatic disable happened. I asked on ML if we should extend the criteria for  active foundation member from election voting to ATC, AUC or more. You are contributing but just not voting in election can drop you from foundation seems odd to me."}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:46:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

We automatically move users to Community members (meaning no voting privileges) from Foundation members if they don't vote in two elections in a row. Community members don't have visible profiles on the site, only Foundation members.

That's the case here.  In order to upgrade to a Foundation member, Douglas should go to https://www.openstack.org/profile/ and click on "Change to Foundation Member"'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:50:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> We automatically move users to Community members (meaning no voting
 > privileges) from Foundation members if they don't vote in two
 > elections in a row. Community members don't have visible profiles
 > on the site, only Foundation members.
 > 
 > That's the case here.  In order to upgrade to a Foundation member,
 > Douglas should go to https://www.openstack.org/profile/ and click
 > on "Change to Foundation Member"

thanks for confirming Jimmy. But can we extend/modify the criteria to ATC,AUC also ? if someone contributing in the community should be active members even though he/she does not vote in election for various reasons.'}, {'account_id': 10278, 'date': '2020-04-01 00:57:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

ATC/AUC is a separate set of requirements.  Foundation Members are established by a) joining the foundation and b) continuing to participate in elections.  It's a bylaws thing, so don't quote me on that, but that's the gist."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-01 01:02:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> ATC/AUC is a separate set of requirements.  Foundation Members are
 > established by a) joining the foundation and b) continuing to
 > participate in elections.  It's a bylaws thing, so don't quote me
 > on that, but that's the gist.

yeah I know. I think time to change that bylaw :) (which is very hard task but the right thing for long term)"}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-04-01 20:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-04-01 20:06:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi All,  I apologize for letting my Foundation membership lapse.  Was not aware this would happen.  Hopefully we can make an exception for the deadline, as I just now noticed this patch failed to merge.'}, {'account_id': 16708, 'date': '2020-04-01 21:44:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2

I think at this point, since you missed having a valid patch before the deadline and the TC will be appointing the PTL (likely you since you are interested :)) I will -2 this since we don't accept candidacies after the deadline."}, {'account_id': 7973, 'date': '2020-04-02 14:01:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Fix python2 support

It seems that CentOS gate images have py3 isntalled by default while
we didin't backport centos py3 support into train.

This also pins rally version to the one which still supports py2 and
make rally use branch specific u-c as master ones moved on and pins
libraries that require py3 only.

This temporary fix the issue with our gates until
proper backport of centos py3 support, once libselinux will be available

Change-Id: I4ead736617ac189559b0c091cbd86896cc20977c

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Add test-requirements.txt to doc building, hacking is now imported and
needed for autodoc.

Change-Id: I06211ef20131c64deba135123e53d87f3b5356a2

commit_message:
Cleanup stale interface if exists

There is a bug in the CentOS 8 image where the ens3 interface file
exists. We should clean that up if it exists to prevent issues when
booting. We manage the interfaces later with os-net-config so we don't
want them to exist in the image.

Similar patch was done in tripleo-image-elements for the overcloud
images: I95d851f194a524caad639188e7df8f041fa2a248

Change-Id: I089aee2f2d37f7788f2a2b1bd71a646197ed54f8
Closes-Bug: #1866202

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

python-masakariclient is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: I299939dd0a1a0d0726574d6f32186d4ca818437d

[{'created': '2020-04-01 18:21:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in zun-ui uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/

Change-Id: Idd2a57af3b8507a2d473a34f7b2551f66557136c
'}]
commit_message:
Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in zun-ui uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/

Change-Id: Idd2a57af3b8507a2d473a34f7b2551f66557136c
