revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 19:42:53.000000000', 'message': 'tripleo_container_manage/podman/create: pull images upfront

Before creating/running containers, pull their images upfront so the
task which runs podman_container has less chance to timeout if a slow
networking is used.

The new task will try during 1h to pull all the images in the batch; and
check the status every 5 seconds until the 1h limit is reached.

Change-Id: I9db97c0420d48461d2b19286ea226bdbb58e12b7
'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 23:01:01.000000000', 'message': 'WIP tripleo_container_manage/podman/create: pull images upfront

task which runs podman_container has less chance to timeout if a slow
networking is used.

The new task will try during 1h to pull all the images in the batch; and
check the status every 5 seconds until the 1h limit is reached.

Change-Id: I9db97c0420d48461d2b19286ea226bdbb58e12b7
'}, {'created': '2020-04-02 02:13:52.000000000', 'message': "tripleo_container_manage/podman/create: pull images upfront

Before creating/running containers, pull their images upfront so the
task which runs podman_container has less chance to timeout if a slow
networking is used.

The new task will try during 1h to pull all the images in the batch; and
check the status every 5 seconds until the 1h limit is reached.

Note: it's using command instead of podman_image for now as the module
has not been stable when using async so far. We'll fix later.

Change-Id: I9db97c0420d48461d2b19286ea226bdbb58e12b7
"}]
commit_message:
tripleo_container_manage/podman/create: pull images upfront

Before creating/running containers, pull their images upfront so the
task which runs podman_container has less chance to timeout if a slow
networking is used.

The new task will try during 1h to pull all the images in the batch; and
check the status every 5 seconds until the 1h limit is reached.

Note: it's using command instead of podman_image for now as the module
has not been stable when using async so far. We'll fix later.

Change-Id: I9db97c0420d48461d2b19286ea226bdbb58e12b7

commit_message:
Raise hacking to latest 2.0.0 release

We were capped at a very old version of hacking. Hacking itself caps the
various linters it uses to remain consistent, so our pep8 job was not
checking quite a bit that current versions have added.

This raises that limit to the latest to get up to the level of other
projects and addresses the errors the updated linters uncovered.

Change-Id: I89a9d73fbd59606a649e26077acebc5c42873d67
Co-authored-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fix misused deployment vs connection timeouts

Fix misused ansible connection timeout and deployment timeout passed in
config download and ansible runner utility.

Allow ansible runner utility to be given a job_timeout as well.

Also fix the misuse of timeout parameters in related worklows. Add
--overcloud-ssh-port-timeout and use it to configure ansible connection
timeout for the DeleteNode and ProvisionNode interaces of the involved
workflows. Then use the timeout parameter as real timeout instead of
mistakingly passing it as a connection timeout.

Add new unit test for ansible timeout in config_download. Add missing
coverage for the existing timeout-related params in other unit tests.

Closes-Bug: #1868063
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/716980
Change-Id: I2a4d151bcb83074af5bcf7d1b8c68d81d3c0400d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

Related-Bug: #1868063

Change-Id: I3f880d17dbc15064984f251af7d294b78c8b2110
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
libvirt: Always provide the size in bytes when calling virDomainBlockResize

Since 0.9.11 virDomainBlockResize has accepted the size argument in
bytes when the VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_RESIZE_BYTES flag is provided.

This change switches all callers over to using bytes to simplify the
required call, avoiding the need to divide by units.Ki etc.

Change-Id: Ib8d9318596186acd86a738ceea187420698645e6

commit_message:
[WIP] Start to remove the last uses of Mistral in tripleoclient

This patch helps releal some of the remaining work. they should be fixed
in related patches and then this rebased on them.

Change-Id: I7ceab75ebede68ac3e37719ac0bd6b7554ef307e

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine
what is wrong.

Example:

commit_message:
Make deploy step failure logging indicate the error

Deploy step logging would previously only log the step to the API
user, instead of anything the API user could use to try and determine
what is wrong.

Example:
- Trying to power on a machine as part of deploy.deploy()
- Power-on operation fails
- Only the deploy step is listed as the error, and no
  additional information to troubleshoot the issue,
  which forced the operator to go examine logs and
  find the error.

Change-Id: If60b96dcafa446de090df56089760eda3a21109d

commit_message:
Enable neutron-ovn jobs in check queue

Jobs:
* neutron-ovn-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode
* neutron-ovn-rally

were disabled during the process of migration of networking-ovn code
to the neutron repo.
Now those jobs should runs fine so lets enable them as non-voting
jobs first.

Additionally job "neutron-ovn-tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode"
was in the meantime renamed to be the
"neutron-ovn-tripleo-ci-centos-8-containers-multinode" as it runs on
CentOS 8 now.

Change-Id: I90e038767101e12ba94cdc7ed7431bc3e34b8044

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (1 of 2)

This is part 1 of 2, where ovn provider info located in
tripleo::profile::base::octavia::api will move
to newly created octavia::provider::ovn.
But that has to be split into 2 parts to avoid breaking the
CI until the THT+pupple-tripleo changes merges [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bug/1861886+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714895/

Change-Id: I85049de9960586a1069aa750c8d727c6e37cec73
Related-Bug: #1861886
(cherry picked from commit c68aa2e140890478156aa197a4217bd362e913ab)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 13:18:10.000000000', 'message': "Correct NodeTLSData service removal.

When running the tripleo-upgrade role in an environment without the
NodeTLSData service enabled, the task was failing as it couldn't find the
tls_node_data parameter. We need a guard to avoid this happens. Also, corrects
the format and name of the task that does the substitution.

Change-Id: Ic2871955a05a803b46daa153f978dcd58762fe20
"}]
commit_message:
Correct NodeTLSData service removal.

When running the tripleo-upgrade role in an environment without the
NodeTLSData service enabled, the task was failing as it couldn't find the
tls_node_data parameter. We need a guard to avoid this happens. Also, corrects
the format and name of the task that does the substitution.

Change-Id: Ic2871955a05a803b46daa153f978dcd58762fe20

commit_message:
Added two new Rally scenarios

the new scenarios are a workflow that contains Jinja,
Yaql expressions on a relatively big json object
(4mb in size).

the input for these two Scenarios is :
 1. the number of tasks in the workflow
    - 30 in rally task
 2. the size of the param object in mb
    - 4mb in rally task

Change-Id: Ib33f26573b4b46a628f7d1d28fd18dedcb9c4738

commit_message:
Add TripleO Jobs back

This patch also add dependency to the linters jobs to save the CI.

Change-Id: I0e740679f668fbc923a4adf7e487b0853c9f10b2
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
images: Remove Libvirt specific configurable use from qemu_img_info

This change addresses an old TODO in the images module by dropping the
use of a Libvirt specific configurable from the qemu_img_info function.
We can identify RBD based volumes by checking for 'rbd:' at the start of
the path provided to the function instead of using the configurable.

Change-Id: Ife9e67d5c71f4cca825dff713f54ec955508f6e6

commit_message:
Removes handling of Identity v2.0 API from tempest.conf

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/506751/ disables the v2.0
  identity API in tempest. This patch removes enabling of
  identity v2.0 API.

Change-Id: I07b48ad88ce7ece4a782248ee8dc652aac442620

commit_message:
Remove enabling IDENTITY_V2 API

* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/506751/ disables the v2.0
  identity API in tempest and from Queens cycle, projects have
  already switched to identity v3. So it would be good to remove
  the same.

Depends-On: I07b48ad88ce7ece4a782248ee8dc652aac442620
Change-Id: I8449f79a8e3c90bfebe0719d3bc23e4301f8e526

@Arxcruz, I found the issue. We need to give full path of generated tmepest.conf then it will work
http://logs.openstack.org/84/581084/28/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario002-multinode-oooq-container-refstack/69fd166/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/tempest.log.txt.gz#_2018-09-14_10_21_25

otherwise it is taking /etc/tempest/tempest.conf.
I am going to update the changes,'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-09-14 12:53:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 52.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-09-14 15:31:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 52:

(1 comment)

No, the problem is that when you run refstack-client config, it generates the accounts.yaml, and set the use_dynamic_credentials to true, instead of false, and so it fails, that's the only difference from the refstack job running on python-tempestconf and this one, because we generate the accounts.yaml file before we run the refstack-client config, so it set the use_dynamic_credentials to false. I just tested your theory on an environment that I have up, and it did not work."}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-09-14 15:32:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 52:

Also refstack client looks for tenant_name instead of project_name, even though on tempest side both will work, when refstack pass this to keystone, it goes as none.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-09-16 10:30:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 53.'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2018-09-17 07:01:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 54.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-09-17 10:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 54: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-28 06:05:36.000000000', 'message': 'Enable support for running refstack tests in TQE

RefStack tests are a set of tempest tests used for interop
certifications.

It addes 3 variable for the same:
- tempest_run_refstack to run refstack tests
- tempest_refstack_url per release
- tempest_refstack_tests based on release name

it will help to perform sanity of the cloud using refstack tests.

Change-Id: I1bd4eedaa58819a4251302d37198bf6b29c49b6c

commit_message:
Enable support for running refstack tests in TQE

RefStack tests are a set of tempest tests used for interop certifications.
It addes 3 variable for the same:
  - tempest_run_refstack to run refstack tests
  - tempest_refstack_url per release
  - tempest_refstack_tests based on release name.

It uses refstack-client config to generate tempest.conf
It will help to perform sanity of the cloud using refstack tests.
It uses refstack-client utility to run refstack tests.
Use --no-share flag while creating networks for running refstack
tests.

Once refstack tests run finishes it will copy all refstack related
artifacts to tempest directory in order to generate tempest html
results.

Change-Id: I1bd4eedaa58819a4251302d37198bf6b29c49b6c

I think that the fact that screen will be removed in RHEL 8 is a good enough reason (for me) to make the change.

I don't think we should increase complexity by making it configurable
unless we have an OS where tmux is not available.

On the other hand the comment message:
- missing motivation / explanation *why*
- not including any reference to a bug (#Closes-Bug:)

This would be the only reason why I would downvote."}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-09-21 08:45:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Added tempest.conf for heat_plugin

* It also removes the old orchestration tempest.conf and resume
  instance type under heat_plugin

commit_message:
Use the correct heat tests

The heat tests referenced no longer exist. This patch changes the
tests used to reference to new tests which are the same as those
used by the heat gates.

Change-Id: I78a2a869efb47344bc262bcd526b663fd0384c9c

automatically.

commit_message:
Added dependency of os_tempest role

In order to ensure that the config_template action module is loaded
by Ansible without requiring the path to the module being set
explicitly in configuration, we set config_template as a
meta-dependency. This will make Ansible load the module
automatically.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/638383

Related-Bug: #1791258

Change-Id: I56cae67426429928dace571eebb7cd64e6f2ed12

commit_message:
Add delorean-deps.repo in OSA

delorean-deps.repo provides all the CI passed dependencies which
is not maintained with in openstack ecosystem. It is very useful
to use the latest packages.

Use openstack_hosts_rdo_deps_url var to log the value of
delorean-deps.repo.

Change-Id: Ib24340bf3ddd0d698f6f42e358bdc65792411daf

commit_message:
Move ipmi logging to a separate option

The IPMI verbose output being turned on by the debug option
is confusing and misleading, and since many operators run
ironic in debug mode anyway, it doesn't make much sense
to spam logs with errors and information that can be
misleading to a less experienced operator.

Also... less logging output.

Back-porting per discussion[0] in IRC where we believe
this is the best action possible and the verbose ipmitool
output tends not to be extremely helpful for operators.

[0]: http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2020-04-01.log.html#t2020-04-01T16:02:43

Change-Id: I0fae7bad5613865dfd4d1c663be08d40debe157a
(cherry picked from commit 1e514b64404ee668ff0651ffb2ad30217f5b1b81)

Update peers with API addresses

Use default_update_peers which will publish admin, internal and public
addresses to peers.

Closes-Bug: #1858132
(cherry picked from commit d4af1718e7d7acbf3f5972152d263a28e6e47058)

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8. Note that the repo has been
running hacking 2 for some time due to uncapped setup, and thus fixes
are needed for N350 - the uncapped setup disabled the local hacking
rules. They are now enabled again.

Change-Id: I25e5201933f65ba4d3045e6445f0e6419ea57f3e

subject: Release new rocky version for heat repos
messages:
[{'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-03-26 17:44:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-26 17:50:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2020-03-26 18:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-27 10:52:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-27 17:43:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've sussed why the docs build is failing here. reno is trying to find an earlier branch than 'stable/v4-branch', which was been deleted and replaced by 'v4-branch-eol' and is doing so alphabetically [1]. This causes it to select 'stable/train' (t < v) and search for the earliest tag on _that_ branch, '13.0.0.0rc1', from the 'stable/v4-branch' branch. That's what excludes.

The solution seems to be to use stricter regexes for the various branches and tags. I'll propose that shortly.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/reno/blob/3.0.0/reno/scanner.py#L850-L852"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-02 07:12:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Add tempest tests to zuul

Add tempest tests to zuul check and gate. This includes two parts of
tests:
- Tests in tempest repo
- Tests in cinder-tempest-plugin

Change-Id: I6ea4d60f41bf0d312360c450e0038bc6f21a44ce
Signed-off-by: Liang Fang <liang.a.fang@intel.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 19:56:20.000000000', 'message': 'Release final tosca-parser for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: I79076ebf78001c78fac4626c792cf796165e729f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 20:21:59.000000000', 'message': 'Release final tosca-parser for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,

commit_message:
Fix CONFIGS=None issue with action openstack-upgrade

When the CONFIGS was made lazy in the charm, unfortunately, some of the
work wasn't carried through correctly to the openstack-upgrade action
code.  This patch corrects that.  Tested manually as okay.

Change-Id: I095613ef2eca62da5fae5462e76fa83926d2e80a
Closes-Bug: #1869865
(cherry picked from commit 851821ff39a66fcdd75b414427b64c2979ba8bb7)

[{'created': '2020-04-01 18:01:40.000000000', 'message': 'Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not
needed in installations.

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they are not
needed in installations.

Change-Id: Ia4740a1dc343d7a4a303674d9377bc64f6df762b

commit_message:
Disable negative subnetpool test

Temporary disable negative test that forbids assigning
shared address scope to subnet pool for tenant users.

Change-Id: I13dd36b3364b7a0f3241efa6ba5f8c3b2246f167
Partial-Bug: #1862968

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 14:14:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit

Deploy HAProxy on one or more servers. Add another server to the
inventory in the haproxy group, and run the following:

kolla-ansible prechecks --limit <new host>

The following task will fail:

    TASK [haproxy : Checking if kolla_internal_vip_address and
    kolla_external_vip_address are not pingable from any node]

This happens because ansible does not execute on hosts where
haproxy/keepalived is running, and therefore does not know that the VIP
should be active.

This change skips VIP prechecks when not all HAProxy hosts are in the
play.

Closes-Bug: #1868986

Change-Id: Ifbc73806b768f76f803ab01c115a9e5c2e2492ac

commit_message:
Fix HAProxy prechecks during scale-out with limit

Deploy HAProxy on one or more servers. Add another server to the
inventory in the haproxy group, and run the following:

kolla-ansible prechecks --limit <new host>

The following task will fail:

    TASK [haproxy : Checking if kolla_internal_vip_address and
    kolla_external_vip_address are not pingable from any node]

This happens because ansible does not execute on hosts where
haproxy/keepalived is running, and therefore does not know that the VIP
should be active.

This change skips VIP prechecks when not all HAProxy hosts are in the
play.

Closes-Bug: #1868986

Change-Id: Ifbc73806b768f76f803ab01c115a9e5c2e2492ac

commit_message:
Add jitter to inspection command reporting

Adds a jitter and backoff behavior to the inspector data
collection command to prevent thundering heard sorts of
issues.

Change-Id: I00517010991cbe43d5958c7d76019ef6fe89c983

commit_message:
Do not fail if /usr/sbin/nft is not present

In change Ia4a2a58aada3b893fa23e04722f0a7d77e05a981 we added some rules
to forcefully cleanup nftables in case those were changed outside our
control. Turns out that some Centos8 CI jobs do not have it installed.
Let's not fail in that cases.

Change-Id: I693d2b3c9de7135416d809b625cff62184a10668
Closes-Bug: #1870095

[{'created': '2020-02-17 21:38:38.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Use stock mock

The mock library was designed to provide backward support for py3
mock-isms into py2. Now that we've dropped py2, we don't need it
anymore.

Unfortunately, simply removing it from our requirements isn't
sufficient, as we still get it through transitive dependencies (from
oslotest, probably, among others).

We wouldn't bother, except the mock library has broken the world as of
4.0.1 (possibly earlier).

TODO(efried): Identify upstream and/or nova bug.

Change-Id: Ib44b5bff657c8e76c4f701e14d51a4efda3f6d32
"}, {'created': '2020-02-19 23:34:53.000000000', 'message': "Use stock mock

The mock library was designed to provide backward support for py3
mock-isms into py2. Now that we've dropped py2, we don't need it
anymore.

Unfortunately, simply removing it from our requirements isn't
sufficient, as we still get it through transitive dependencies (from
oslotest, probably, among others). So we have to explicitly say

 from unittest import mock

We wouldn't bother, except the mock library has broken the world as of
4.0.1 (possibly earlier) [1], and the requirements project would like to
be able to bump upper-constraints.

[1] https://github.com/testing-cabal/mock/issues/487

Change-Id: Ib44b5bff657c8e76c4f701e14d51a4efda3f6d32
"}]
commit_message:
Use stock mock

The mock library was designed to provide backward support for py3
mock-isms into py2. Now that we've dropped py2, we don't need it
anymore.

Unfortunately, simply removing it from our requirements isn't
sufficient, as we still get it through transitive dependencies (from
oslotest, probably, among others). So we have to explicitly say

 from unittest import mock

We wouldn't bother, except the mock library has broken the world as of
4.0.1 (possibly earlier) [1], and the requirements project would like to
be able to bump upper-constraints.

[1] https://github.com/testing-cabal/mock/issues/487

Change-Id: Ib44b5bff657c8e76c4f701e14d51a4efda3f6d32

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 10:34:43.000000000', 'message': 'rabbitmq: Open ports 25673-25683 for CLI tools

Since RabbitMQ 3.7.4, the CLI tools (rabbitmqctl and friends)
parallelize the querying of information from cluster members.  In
order to receive stream data back, the cli instance binds and
registers itself on an available port (default between 35672 and
35682, inclusive).  If these ports are firewalled off, then
rabbitmqctl commands such as list_queues will hang waiting for data
from remote cluster members.

This patch does two things:

1) Reconfigures rabbitmqctl to bind to 25673-25683 instead of the
default range of 35672-35682.  This ensures the ports are not in the
ephemeral port range and avoids unintended collisions.

2) Opens the firewall on 25673-25683 to enable communication.

Resolves: rhbz#1811680

Change-Id: If5caa51cd9a3aef97d06d491dde1d5129cc1a569
(cherry picked from commit a2bc2e10b0de522a81faca62b7b620432b267fbb)
(cherry picked from commit 40a1e5ba18095692640f2c22b7fafb132912d06e)
'}]
commit_message:
rabbitmq: Open ports 25673-25683 for CLI tools

Since RabbitMQ 3.7.4, the CLI tools (rabbitmqctl and friends)
parallelize the querying of information from cluster members.  In
order to receive stream data back, the cli instance binds and
registers itself on an available port (default between 35672 and
35682, inclusive).  If these ports are firewalled off, then
rabbitmqctl commands such as list_queues will hang waiting for data
from remote cluster members.

This patch does two things:

1) Reconfigures rabbitmqctl to bind to 25673-25683 instead of the
default range of 35672-35682.  This ensures the ports are not in the
ephemeral port range and avoids unintended collisions.

2) Opens the firewall on 25673-25683 to enable communication.

Resolves: rhbz#1811680

Change-Id: If5caa51cd9a3aef97d06d491dde1d5129cc1a569
(cherry picked from commit a2bc2e10b0de522a81faca62b7b620432b267fbb)
(cherry picked from commit 40a1e5ba18095692640f2c22b7fafb132912d06e)

subject: Maintain OSD state on upgrade
messages: [{'account_id': 935, 'date': '2020-04-01 15:39:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20634, 'date': '2020-04-02 08:34:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 15:39:21.000000000', 'message': "Maintain OSD state on upgrade

Ensure each OSD reaches its pre-restart state before proceeding
after restart. This prevents the charm from finalizing the upgrade
prior to OSDs recovering after upgrade. For example, if the state
is 'active' prior to restart, then it must reach 'active' after
restart, at which point the upgrade will be allowed to complete.

Change-Id: I66359963b5e8e792d23b7989f07b7ac67afcd9b0
Closes-Bug: #1821028
(cherry picked from commit 26114b2a544b4b2e3bb2b43839fd18e3d395d95a)
"}]
commit_message:
Maintain OSD state on upgrade

Ensure each OSD reaches its pre-restart state before proceeding
after restart. This prevents the charm from finalizing the upgrade
prior to OSDs recovering after upgrade. For example, if the state
is 'active' prior to restart, then it must reach 'active' after
restart, at which point the upgrade will be allowed to complete.

Change-Id: I66359963b5e8e792d23b7989f07b7ac67afcd9b0
Closes-Bug: #1821028
(cherry picked from commit 26114b2a544b4b2e3bb2b43839fd18e3d395d95a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 09:27:09.000000000', 'message': 'Get event marker before doing update

As we now have ansible playbook running the stack create/update
and would only finish when the stack has been *_COMPLETE/*_FAILED,
we need to get the event marker before doing the update, else there
would be no events listed for subsequent deploy (stack update).

Left the call to utils.wait_for_stack_ready() for the time being.
We can just get the events as the stack operation is finished or
move the event polling to the playbook.

Change-Id: I746f3bb135fac309bb7e780648e3e8216d76770e
'}]
commit_message:
Get event marker before doing update

As we now have ansible playbook running the stack create/update
and would only finish when the stack has been *_COMPLETE/*_FAILED,
we need to get the event marker before doing the update, else there
would be no events listed for subsequent deploy (stack update).

Left the call to utils.wait_for_stack_ready() for the time being.
We can just get the events as the stack operation is finished or
move the event polling to the playbook.

Change-Id: I746f3bb135fac309bb7e780648e3e8216d76770e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-03 11:56:43.000000000', 'message': 'Add option to get ethX interfaces on centos-8

We want to make sure network interfaces get ethX names in the
upstream centos-8 images. This is done by adding the "net.ifnames=0"
parameter to the kernel command-line.

In our case, we use the DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE option when
building the image. We add the current default parameters, in addition
to the new one [1].
As it's done in RDO CI [2].

[1] -
https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/2.6.1/elements/bootloader/README.html#arguments
[2] https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/#/c/17697/

Change-Id: I0bdfedcc5bb00577e9c5e59a7e978fe30438eabd
Co-Author: Javier Pena <jpena@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to get ethX interfaces on centos-8

We want to make sure network interfaces get ethX names in the
upstream centos-8 images. This is done by adding the "net.ifnames=0"
parameter to the kernel command-line.

In our case, we use the DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE option when
building the image. We add the current default parameters, in addition
to the new one [1].
As it's done in RDO CI [2].

[1] -
https://docs.openstack.org/diskimage-builder/2.6.1/elements/bootloader/README.html#arguments
[2] https://softwarefactory-project.io/r/#/c/17697/

Change-Id: I0bdfedcc5bb00577e9c5e59a7e978fe30438eabd
Co-Author: Javier Pena <jpena@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Optimize device profiles APIs

Make ""DeviceProfileCollection" inherit ""DeviceProfile"" and delete
the @classmethod decorator of the current method, the decorator does
not work here.

nit: Rename two functions, change get_api_obj() to get_device_profile(),
change get_api_objs() to get_device_profiles().

Change-Id: Id0b0d00799ba16bf9b86747908ce3f373b65bb5b

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in remote consoles policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type as ['system', 'project']
for remote consoles policy.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4ea042f3686e2bd8f589f20d3dbfdfc63bc4343c

commit_message:
Add new default roles in rescue server policies

This adds new defaults roles in rescue server API policies
 to system admin or project member.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I5816abd33002b2036068cc686c3d0d44d66ee976

commit_message:
tripleo_deploy: finish the loop of operations early if wrong rc

If one of the operations running Ansible playbooks returns a wrong rc,
leave the loop and go to final tasks before raising.

It'll prevent the upgrade tasks to fail but the other playbooks (e.g.
deploy) to keep running.

Closes-Bug: #1869230
Change-Id: I5b1bb964ed290c860e66074202c45d7dd09bf29c

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 05:03:57.000000000', 'message': "Add test coverage of existing remote console policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing remote consoles policies.

Also pass the actual target which is server's project_id in policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I6d6002de59d87f99df3577f8c97d3aaba7c611e8
"}, {'created': '2020-04-01 05:48:58.000000000', 'message': "Add test coverage of existing remote console policies

Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they

- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,

and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

Change-Id: I6d6002de59d87f99df3577f8c97d3aaba7c611e8
"}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing remote console policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing remote consoles policies.

Also pass the actual target which is server's project_id in policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I6d6002de59d87f99df3577f8c97d3aaba7c611e8

commit_message:
Fixed build-test-packages role to build pkgs other than openstack

Since gnocchixyz/gnocchi is developed on github and does not comes
under openstack namespace it will help to build this package in
the periodic as well as in openstack ci jobs

Fixed zuul_deps to set host github.com for non-openstack
projects.

Change-Id: I9dfb993b54b9584ab31509ee77c5ace1856b0d11

commit_message:
Put tempest_service_available_neutron to fs overrides

In few jobs, we donot need neutron services while running tempest
and in os_tempest, it is enabled by default. Putting it under
fs overrides gives the flexibility to disable it.

It is needed for scenario 000 job for podman testing.

Change-Id: I6ebfad88f4e1b5d005f115ce38b2b942a2be1369
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-04-01 06:08:06.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in rescue server policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for rescue server API policies
as:
- ['system', 'project'] for rescue/unrescue policy even
for unlock server locked by other policy so that operators
have option to add few project scoped role like admin to
these operation.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Idf60a3d9aff3607739d2d3d2ff5d20877a477782
"}]
commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in rescue server policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for rescue server API policies
as:
- ['system', 'project'] for rescue/unrescue policy even
for unlock server locked by other policy so that operators
have option to add few project scoped role like admin to
these operation.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Idf60a3d9aff3607739d2d3d2ff5d20877a477782

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 06:04:25.000000000', 'message': "Add test coverage of existing rescue policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing unrescue policies.

Also pass the actual target which is server's project_id in unrescue policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I04087be1e0023c026c06b690f20126472b0b63f0
"}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing rescue policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing unrescue policies.

Also pass the actual target which is server's project_id in unrescue policy.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I04087be1e0023c026c06b690f20126472b0b63f0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 11:14:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add a utility for JSON serialization

* This patch adds a utility that helps serialize data into a JSON
  string that might contain some non-standard data types like
  generators iterators and frozen dicts coming from YAQL. The
  utility uses oslo.serialization project that already takes care
  of iterators and any kinds of custom dicts. And in addition, it
  handles generators (assuming a generator represents an iterable
  similar to an iterator).
* Unit tests.
* Added YAQL into requirements and bumped the version of
  oslo.serialization to make sure to have the "fallback" parameter
  in "jsonutils.to_primitive"

Change-Id: I2fe891525bc86beb92aecf9ac2d8a490837c47d3
'}, {'created': '2020-03-31 11:33:20.000000000', 'message': 'Add a utility for JSON serialization

* This patch adds a utility that helps serialize data into a JSON
  string that might contain some non-standard data types like
  generators iterators and frozen dicts coming from YAQL. The
  utility uses oslo.serialization project that already takes care
  of iterators and any kinds of custom dicts. And in addition, it
  handles generators (assuming a generator represents an iterable
  similar to an iterator).
* Unit tests.
* Added YAQL into requirements and bumped the version of
  oslo.serialization to make sure to have the "fallback" parameter
  in "jsonutils.to_primitive"

Change-Id: I2fe891525bc86beb92aecf9ac2d8a490837c47d3
'}]
commit_message:
Add a utility for JSON serialization

* This patch adds a utility that helps serialize data into a JSON
  string that might contain some non-standard data types like
  generators iterators and frozen dicts coming from YAQL. The
  utility uses oslo.serialization project that already takes care
  of iterators and any kinds of custom dicts. And in addition, it
  handles generators (assuming a generator represents an iterable
  similar to an iterator).
* Unit tests.
* Added YAQL into requirements and bumped the version of
  oslo.serialization to make sure to have the "fallback" parameter
  in "jsonutils.to_primitive"

Change-Id: I2fe891525bc86beb92aecf9ac2d8a490837c47d3

commit_message:
Added scope to introspection rules.

Added 'scope' property to IntrospectionRule and logic to check if a node
falls in the same scope.This allows introspection rules to be applied on
selected nodes instead of every one of them.

Story: 2006995
Task: 37763

Change-Id: I77034f032ea0ec16886afdd928546eb801f7a90a

commit_message:
Expose placement_aggregate_required_for_tenants parameter

Add support for configuring scheduler parameter option
`placement_aggregate_required_for_tenants` which controls
whether or not a tenant with no aggregate affinity will be
allowed to schedule to any available node.

Change-Id: I61e3784ff40665ced25a52f864455c2a3518def0

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 20:46:39.000000000', 'message': "Pass the actual target in unlock override policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for unlock override policies
which is servr project_id because policy rule is system and
project scoped.

Adding tests also to show that rule can be override with project
roles.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ie3e6667df1e8f5d3e96ac291106f7e4b0273f0ef
"}, {'created': '2020-04-01 04:06:01.000000000', 'message': "Pass the actual target in unlock override policy

oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

which is server project_id because policy rule is system and

Adding tests also to show that rule can be override with project

Change-Id: Ie3e6667df1e8f5d3e96ac291106f7e4b0273f0ef

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in unlock override policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for unlock override policies
which is server project_id because policy rule is system and
project scoped.

Adding tests also to show that rule can be override with project
roles.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ie3e6667df1e8f5d3e96ac291106f7e4b0273f0ef

commit_message:
Adds bandit template and exclude some of tests

Adds bandit configuration template and exclude some of
tests that we don't want to fix for the moment.

Keeping job unvoted so that we can keep an eye on possible
issues while not breaking gate.

Change-Id: Ic577cad3b61421c04023ea887236992acb19f77c
Story: 2005791
Task: 33518

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in migrate server policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for migrate server policies
which is server project_id because policy rule is system and
project scoped.

Adding tests also to show that rule can be override with project
roles.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I3050b7c60ccfe8b737b4dbb93f00f6d6ca82bc6d

commit_message:
run the python testcases in serial.

This is a temporary solution.
It is better is to dubug the race testcases, and control these in
serial.

Ref:
https://stestr.readthedocs.io/en/latest/MANUAL.html#cmdoption-stestr-run-serial

commit_message:
Using podman/docker ps to look for running sidecars

We've been running into numerous issues with searching on patterns in
the command so using the container CLI to match seems better.

Change-Id: I13633ab4d5ebfc7f52b7215523c310fe72a5487e
Closes-Bug: #1869384
(cherry picked from commit b187fb5b629e3ef032d5915a89267f5266f5d373)

commit_message:
Add Cyborg API Reference to Cyborg index page

On the Cyborg latest page [1], the API link to the end user is missing.

This commits also removed bellow from the "Indices and tables":

* :ref:`genindex`
* :ref:`modindex`

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cyborg/latest/

Change-Id: Ib7694effc38838829607c654fe4000eb51ca109f

commit_message:
Upgrade minversion to match python3

ignore_basepython_conflict flag is introduced in that version so we need
to raise it if using that flag.

Change-Id: Ie40535ebe42504aceb7c15efbce52038ce3f9b3b

subject: Install OPAE tools library.
messages:
[{'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-25 04:12:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 25738, 'date': '2019-09-25 06:46:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 30759, 'date': '2019-10-10 08:07:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

One question:
I always install the opae-tools-"extra"-<release> package adding to the opae-tools-<release>, referring to the OPAE install manual[1].
Is that not necessary package?

[1] https://opae.github.io/latest/docs/fpga_api/quick_start/readme.html#installing-the-opae-sdk-from-rpm-or-deb-packages'}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2020-01-07 00:08:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> One question:
 > I always install the opae-tools-"extra"-<release> package adding to
 > the opae-tools-<release>, referring to the OPAE install manual[1].
 > Is that not necessary package?
 > 
 > [1] https://opae.github.io/latest/docs/fpga_api/quick_start/readme.html#installing-the-opae-sdk-from-rpm-or-deb-packages

Yes, we need that too.

With the recent OPAE versions, it makes sense for the admin to install all the RPMs, including drivers and user space tools, as part of the host configuration, as documented in [1]. 

Reasons why it is better to let admin install it instead of doing it in Cyborg OPAE plugin:
* It is consistent with the documentation.
* As new OPAE versions come out, we don't need to update the OPAE plugin in Cyborg (which we haven't been doing anyway).

What do you all think?


[1] https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/programmable/documentation/iyu1522005567196.html#prr1522431171180'}, {'account_id': 30759, 'date': '2020-01-07 04:22:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Reasons why it is better to let admin install it instead of doing
 > it in Cyborg OPAE plugin:
 > * It is consistent with the documentation.
 > * As new OPAE versions come out, we don't need to update the OPAE
 > plugin in Cyborg (which we haven't been doing anyway).
 > 
 > What do you all think?
 > 
 > 
 > [1] https://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/programmable/documentation/iyu1522005567196.html#prr1522431171180

I approve your opinion above,to install OPAE manually by admin is simple and avoid problems related to versions."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2020-04-02 04:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Better to move to new OPAE version, as discussed in Cyborg IRC.'}]

commit_message:
Install OPAE tools library.

The library is needed to get the FPGA programming tool. But this
still does not include OpenCL programming tool.

Change-Id: I78120959dd860daec327f7fe4341301a2ac1a83e

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in migrate server

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for migrate server API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Icba4c14f240215fd56f1cdd9814cc81ebf2796be

commit_message:
Add new default roles in migrate server policies

This adds new defaults roles in migrate server API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN role.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I220a1466437ea8582f3d1cee53ff031465d25447

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in magnum-ui uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

commit_message:
Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in magnum-ui uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/

Change-Id: I09c33697cf934fc34313ad7e8b4e4bed336eca4e

commit_message:
Set --bindir when installing bundle

... because recent gem ignores $GEM_HOME to decide the place to which
it install bin files, and we need to set it explicity to have bundle
command installed in $GEM_HOME/bin.

Change-Id: I3a381d43429fbf2b7ae6d90ff7a2bc3018b4a41d
Related-bug: #1866176
(cherry picked from commit b0aff3d5c2e27fd44a003f6df42de062b0d33d5c)

messages: [{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-03-27 18:41:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2020-03-30 08:44:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2020-04-02 00:30:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5689, 'date': '2020-04-02 00:53:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\nthanks'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-27 18:41:27.000000000', 'message': "Replace old requires-python with python-requires

requires-python is old value and does not work, python-requires
is right metadata.

'python-requires' is introduced from PEP440 and requires-python was old value
in PEP345.
- https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#python-requires
- https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0345/#requires-python

Change-Id: Id4a5197ec5dcaab419304e9244f4c6d319e8b5c6
"}]
commit_message:
Replace old requires-python with python-requires

requires-python is old value and does not work, python-requires
is right metadata.

'python-requires' is introduced from PEP440 and requires-python was old value
in PEP345.
- https://packaging.python.org/guides/distributing-packages-using-setuptools/#python-requires
- https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0345/#requires-python

Change-Id: Id4a5197ec5dcaab419304e9244f4c6d319e8b5c6

subject: Update compute hypervisor tests to adopt new policies
messages:
[{'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-01 20:23:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-01 22:59:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23186, 'date': '2020-04-02 00:28:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2020-04-02 00:42:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

you can +A as per new policy :). I am just doing by myself for this before other failue happens.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 20:23:29.000000000', 'message': 'Update compute hypervisor tests to adopt new policies

Nova is moving to new policy defaults in ussuri[1] where
few polciies are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

With granularity in few policies make change in policy name so
we have update the patrole tests to start checking against the
new policy names from ussuri onwards.

This commit updates the hypervisors policy tests
to move to new policies from ussuri onwards.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html

Change-Id: Ic540a42be0b05fc7c53c7ca78f6ff8e5725340e1
'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 22:59:24.000000000', 'message': 'Update compute hypervisor tests to adopt new policies

Nova is moving to new policy defaults in ussuri[1] where
few polciies are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

With granularity in few policies make change in policy name so

commit_message:
Update compute hypervisor tests to adopt new policies

Nova is moving to new policy defaults in ussuri[1] where
few polciies are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

With granularity in few policies make change in policy name so
we have update the patrole tests to start checking against the
new policy names from ussuri onwards.

This commit updates the hypervisors policy tests
to move to new policies from ussuri onwards.

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html

Change-Id: Ic540a42be0b05fc7c53c7ca78f6ff8e5725340e1

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 12:07:34.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Subcribe trunk & subport events to set subport id"

This reverts commit 8ebc635a18fd23fd6595551a703961a4d4392948.

The reverted commit does mass update on all subports of a trunk.
This is not in line with the original design since it causes huge
api-side performance effects.

I think that's the reason why we started seeing gate failures of
rally_openstack.task.scenarios.neutron.trunk.CreateAndListTrunks
in neutron-rally-task.

Change-Id: I6f0fd91c62985207af8dbf29aae463b2b478d5d2
Closes-Bug: #1870110
Related-Bug: #1700428
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Subcribe trunk & subport events to set subport id"

This reverts commit 8ebc635a18fd23fd6595551a703961a4d4392948.

The reverted commit does mass update on all subports of a trunk.
This is not in line with the original design since it causes huge
api-side performance effects.

I think that's the reason why we started seeing gate failures of
rally_openstack.task.scenarios.neutron.trunk.CreateAndListTrunks
in neutron-rally-task.

Change-Id: I6f0fd91c62985207af8dbf29aae463b2b478d5d2
Closes-Bug: #1870110
Related-Bug: #1700428

commit_message:
Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in solum-dashboard uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/

Change-Id: I34a2e55d74c1ac8e8fbd3389ac0b43428be36d4e

commit_message:
Fedora 31 : remove pip-and-virtualenv

As part of [1] we are removing pip-and-virtualenv.  dib 2.35.0 merged
an accidental breakage for Fedora [2].  We might as well use this as
an opportunity to have this as a "bare" test platform; where we leave
configuration of pip/virtualenv up to jobs.  This will be alongside
the ubuntu-bionic-plain images (see
I85438baf5bb31790a56fe5b38327361f0a2398e9).

[1] https://docs.opendev.org/opendev/infra-specs/latest/specs/cleanup-test-node-python.html
[2] https://review.opendev.org/716795

Change-Id: I56a2495e9c768d744ac39073c42a5a1754612f70

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-02 00:13:30.000000000', 'message': 'Add new default roles in security group policies

This adds new defaults roles in security group API policies.
- GET rules are made granular and default to System or project reader
- add/remove sec grps policies are default to system admin or project member.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I000c3b3977e74e992a6b45b48fcaf49983458f6b
'}]
commit_message:
Add new default roles in security group policies

This adds new defaults roles in security group API policies.
- GET rules are made granular and default to System or project reader
- add/remove sec grps policies are default to system admin or project member.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I000c3b3977e74e992a6b45b48fcaf49983458f6b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 01:09:53.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in lock server policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for lock server API policies
as:
- ['system', 'project'] for lock/unlock policy.
- ['system'] for unlock server locked by other policy.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia9b3231c766178faf2f8e9b0d53a7d07f164e8de

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in lock server policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for lock server API policies
as:
- ['system', 'project'] for lock/unlock policy even
for unlock server locked by other policy so that operators
have option to add few project scoped role like admin to
these operation.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Ia9b3231c766178faf2f8e9b0d53a7d07f164e8de

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found by updated hacking version.

Update local hacking checks to work with newer flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, they're
not needed for installation.

Change-Id: Ic7903c61bde999685ca26b5a10d070c8d8d206a3

commit_message:
mysql: allow specifying the authentication method

MySQL users can be configured to require a specific authentication
method when connecting to the MySQL server, e.g. GSSAPI, SHA-256
or ed25519.

Expose a new attribute $plugin, that is passed to puppetlabs-mysql
When creating/updating a user in the MySQL database.

Change-Id: I1c7b40d110190eba861ed466d2644c2f1abbf7b0
Related-Bug: #1866093

commit_message:
Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in senlin-dashboard uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/

Change-Id: If3bef074ca9be89b80b81185397ccb35511f102b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 12:41:57.000000000', 'message': 'Tolerate NFS exports in /var/lib/nova when selinux relabelling

When the :z bind mount option is used, podman peforms a recursive relabel of
the mount point which is failing with "Operation not supported" if there are
any NFS exports mounted within. While it's possible for NFS to support true
selinux labelling, in practice is rarely does.

As we are already walking the tree to set ownership/permission, take ownership
of the relabelling logic too and skip relabelling on subtrees where we hit this
error.

Change-Id: Id5503ed274bd5dc0c5365cc994de7e5cdcbc2fb6
Closes-bug: #1869020
(cherry picked from commit 45dd4e18a5e1609260236047fdf4dfb3d6858bd5)
'}]
commit_message:
Tolerate NFS exports in /var/lib/nova when selinux relabelling

When the :z bind mount option is used, podman peforms a recursive relabel of
the mount point which is failing with "Operation not supported" if there are
any NFS exports mounted within. While it's possible for NFS to support true
selinux labelling, in practice is rarely does.

As we are already walking the tree to set ownership/permission, take ownership
of the relabelling logic too and skip relabelling on subtrees where we hit this
error.

Change-Id: Id5503ed274bd5dc0c5365cc994de7e5cdcbc2fb6
Closes-bug: #1869020
(cherry picked from commit 45dd4e18a5e1609260236047fdf4dfb3d6858bd5)

commit_message:
Add new default roles in lock server policies

This adds new defaults roles in lock server API policies.
- lock/unlock policies are default to system admin or project member.
- unlock server locked by other is system admin.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I2ff285c1ce62030b54bbdc33a33bd3554395da99

commit_message:
Fix parsing for virtual disk RAIDStatus attribute

This patch changes the parsing of virtual disks so
that if the DCIM_VirutalDiskView.RAIDStatus attribute
is not present then DCIM_VirutalDiskView.RaidStatus
will be used instead.
This is needed due to the attribute being renamed in
LCC version 4.0.0

Change-Id: I4ca1b7f6df47ce808920b5e24ad0be6b76963917
(cherry picked from commit 01e7ca19ce4161d9153dfe45520072521b0164b0)

[{'created': '2020-03-25 21:33:08.000000000', 'message': "Pass the actual target in os-hypervisors policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for os-hypervisors policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system scoped rather
than project, so the token scope check deals with the required
target checking.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Pass the actual target in os-hypervisors policy

Currently if target is not passed in context.can(),
it use defauls target which is context.user_id, context.project_id.
These defaults target are not useful as it pass the
context's user_id and project_id only which means we tell
oslo policy to verify the context data with context data.

This commit pass the actual target for os-hypervisors policies
which is empty dict because policy rule is system scoped rather
than project, so the token scope check deals with the required
target checking.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: If5d87de74457ec41a07451d5e397ad4b516339ea

commit_message:
Fix parsing for virtual disk RAIDStatus attribute

This patch changes the parsing of virtual disks so
that if the DCIM_VirutalDiskView.RAIDStatus attribute
is not present then DCIM_VirutalDiskView.RaidStatus
will be used instead.
This is needed due to the attribute being renamed in
LCC version 4.0.0

Change-Id: I4ca1b7f6df47ce808920b5e24ad0be6b76963917
(cherry picked from commit 01e7ca19ce4161d9153dfe45520072521b0164b0)

commit_message:
Bump hacking to 3.0.0

The new version enables a lot of standard flake8 checks, so a few
fixes are required. W503 is disabled as it conflicts with W504
and the latter seems to be preferred nowadays.

Change-Id: I3b1e20193a2cb3d28046ad0f2008577a95aaaefd

commit_message:
standalone: enable ConfigDebug by default

Like we already enable Debug & ContainerImagePrepareDebug by default,
let's also have ConfigDebug which is very handy to have config steps
logs.

Change-Id: I252585a91de919c36c3a0713dc78f7bd4a038025

using versions for which it is possible to change these w/o special
procedures.

commit_message:
Only run netpol check on netpol related changes

This change sets the files attribute for the zuul job that runs
the network policy check to only run when a file change is made
to either the network policy scripts, value overrides, or
job definitions themselves.

Change-Id: I39e28146601e70c48a9b8b19cc683d3e9eb89b63

commit_message:
Drop python 2.7 support and testing

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

senlin-tempest-plugin is ready with python 3 and ok to drop the
python 2.7 support.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal - https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691178/

Change-Id: I53e47c4cf7446c38eb47ad1c889483197a3d8698

subject: Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes
messages: [{'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/train.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-04-01 14:58:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-04-01 19:44:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 13:40:43.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes

Currently an HA deployment making use of PacemakerRemote for any HA role
will fail with the following:
2020-01-16 08:40:22.707 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Start container mysql_restart_bundle as mysql_restart_bundle.
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Path seperator found in volume (/etc/corosync/corosync.conf), but did not exist on the file system
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] /etc/corosync/corosync.conf is not a valid volume source
...
2020-01-16 08:40:53.026 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] The following containers failed validations and were not started: mysql_restart_bundle

The reason for this is that via I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45 (HA: fix
<service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow), we consolidated
all the restart bundles into a single place inside
containers-common.yaml but we forgot to conditionalize the inclusion of
the /etc/corosync/corosync.conf bind mount. In fact this bind mount is
not needed since we started using RHEL/CentOS 8 (i.e. since the podman
introduction). See I399098bf734aa3b2862e1713d4b1f429d180afbc (Fix pcmk
remote podman bundle restarts) for more context

Tested in a composable HA deployment where the Messaging and the
Database roles were using PacemakerRemote and correctly deployed the
environment (which would previously fail):
[root@messaging-0 ~]# crm_mon -1 |grep -e database -e messaging
RemoteOnline: [ database-0 database-1 database-2 messaging-0 messaging-1 messaging-2 ]
 database-0     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 database-1     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 database-2     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 messaging-0    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 messaging-1    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 messaging-2    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 galera-bundle-0      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-0
 galera-bundle-1      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-1
 galera-bundle-2      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-2
 rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-0
 rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-1
 rabbitmq-bundle-2    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-2

Change-Id: I7766a75414bf8db75ccd233677e9ffe13ff28e23
Closes-Bug: #1859945
(cherry picked from commit a30342f253bf63db00a9545aebe50187b9c0324a)
(cherry picked from commit f90eb2caa7b0ea5cfa4b489a0be70be205e1a853)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes

Currently an HA deployment making use of PacemakerRemote for any HA role
will fail with the following:
2020-01-16 08:40:22.707 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Start container mysql_restart_bundle as mysql_restart_bundle.
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Path seperator found in volume (/etc/corosync/corosync.conf), but did not exist on the file system
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] /etc/corosync/corosync.conf is not a valid volume source
...
2020-01-16 08:40:53.026 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] The following containers failed validations and were not started: mysql_restart_bundle

The reason for this is that via I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45 (HA: fix
<service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow), we consolidated
all the restart bundles into a single place inside
containers-common.yaml but we forgot to conditionalize the inclusion of
the /etc/corosync/corosync.conf bind mount. In fact this bind mount is
not needed since we started using RHEL/CentOS 8 (i.e. since the podman
introduction). See I399098bf734aa3b2862e1713d4b1f429d180afbc (Fix pcmk
remote podman bundle restarts) for more context

Tested in a composable HA deployment where the Messaging and the
Database roles were using PacemakerRemote and correctly deployed the
environment (which would previously fail):
[root@messaging-0 ~]# crm_mon -1 |grep -e database -e messaging
RemoteOnline: [ database-0 database-1 database-2 messaging-0 messaging-1 messaging-2 ]
 database-0     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 database-1     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 database-2     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 messaging-0    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 messaging-1    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 messaging-2    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 galera-bundle-0      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-0
 galera-bundle-1      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-1
 galera-bundle-2      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-2
 rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-0
 rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-1
 rabbitmq-bundle-2    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-2

Change-Id: I7766a75414bf8db75ccd233677e9ffe13ff28e23

commit_message:
Fix parsing for virtual disk RAIDStatus attribute

This patch changes the parsing of virtual disks so
that if the DCIM_VirutalDiskView.RAIDStatus attribute
is not present then DCIM_VirutalDiskView.RaidStatus
will be used instead.
This is needed due to the attribute being renamed in
LCC version 4.0.0

Change-Id: I4ca1b7f6df47ce808920b5e24ad0be6b76963917
(cherry picked from commit 01e7ca19ce4161d9153dfe45520072521b0164b0)

commit_message:
Importing keyrings from files rather than from mons

This change permits users to specify a directory where the keyrings are
located.
It is useful when openstack-ansible have no ssh access to the ceph
cluster.

Conflicts: tasks/ceph_auth.yml

Change-Id: I6693a7f9d0bc7fe1e20eee53a96de8df8985e148
(cherry picked from commit db3e9536d403727a964c5cc404e62cff37845c84)

Since commit 125d18e0ffac572749da58fad1591d5099b5cda7, old-style
container-sync is broken because the HEAD requests are not correctly
authenticated. This commit fix it.

Since commit f581fccf71034818d19062593eeb52a4347bb174, X-Timestamp header is
disallowed by the gatekeeper. Container-sync middleware handles it, but when
using old-style container-sync, this middleware is not in the pipeline. By
disabling this gatekeeper behavior, compatiblity is maintained for old-style
container-sync. This commit update the doc.

Change-Id: I9d8828f458448762ec325fcfc7689549752df27b

commit_message:
Fix old-style container-sync and doc

Since commit 125d18e0ffac572749da58fad1591d5099b5cda7, old-style
container-sync is broken because the HEAD requests are not correctly
authenticated. This commit fix it.

Since commit f581fccf71034818d19062593eeb52a4347bb174, X-Timestamp header is
disallowed by the gatekeeper. Container-sync middleware handles it, but when
using old-style container-sync, this middleware is not in the pipeline. By
disabling this gatekeeper behavior, compatiblity is maintained for old-style
container-sync. This commit update the doc.

Change-Id: I9d8828f458448762ec325fcfc7689549752df27b

commit_message:
clarify that extra hardware data does not always go to swift

The documentation about the extra_hardware plugin misled me into
believing I would have to deploy Swift in order to use it. Rephrase
the description to make it clearer that the data is stored wherever
the rest of the introspection data is already being stored.

Change-Id: Ieef5a7e9bd2a7092eb8ff953b79023f5a26df7cf
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Modify SQL upgrade to scale

Many upgrade scripts fails because:
- they modify too many lines for a standard configuration of Galera
  (UPDATE request exceed wsrep_max_ws_rows)
- they updates all rows one by one (too slow)

Closes-Bug: #1772988

Change-Id: Ieb0535a4ea9dbb0eebfcef191894e00576e1b8c8

commit_message:
Fix ovs fw driver for the other ovs agent

In [1] only neutron-openvswitch-agent was fixed and not xenapi.
That merged in Ussuri and went cleanly into Train.
In Stein and Rocky, the backport was not clean and
accidentally fixed xenapi instead of the regular one.

Neither the original bug nor its incomplete fix were released,
except for Rocky. :-(
Hence this patch also removes the confusing reno instead of
adding a new one.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/713129

Change-Id: I331417c8d61ba6f180bcafa943be697418326645
Closes-bug: #1869832
Related-bug: #1867506

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-28 20:03:07.000000000', 'message': 'Use eventlet-aware threading events

For the gory details behind this, see:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1384183

In summary, if you use threading.Event on python2 with eventlet, it
unnecessarily spams system calls to epoll_wait and burns a *lot* of
CPU cycles by constantly context-switching.

I added eventletutils.Event to oslo_utils a while back to
intelligently use the eventlet Event object when eventlet is being
used, and to fall back to the threading one otherwise.  So just use
that and it will do the right thing.

Change-Id: Ib90a94c24386a00ee4968c3bcb68ea83e17d4684
'}, {'created': '2018-04-04 18:55:12.000000000', 'message': 'Use eventlet-aware threading events

commit_message:
Use eventlet-aware threading events

For the gory details behind this, see:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1384183

In summary, if you use threading.Event on python2 with eventlet, it
unnecessarily spams system calls to epoll_wait and burns a *lot* of
CPU cycles by constantly context-switching.

I added eventletutils.Event to oslo_utils a while back to
intelligently use the eventlet Event object when eventlet is being
used, and to fall back to the threading one otherwise.  So just use
that and it will do the right thing.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558879/
Change-Id: Ib90a94c24386a00ee4968c3bcb68ea83e17d4684

commit_message:
Bugfix: Overcome mysql failure during Vitrage init.

Test the connection to detect mysql failures before executing statements.
It is better to fail early because at that point we have retries.

Backported from train

Change-Id: Iee920d215d20efec05a416627fafd1be513e3657

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 06:20:32.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing pause server policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing pause server policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I9eb4d7f348481425992713bd5a0351d710d43669
'}, {'created': '2020-03-31 07:36:00.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing pause server policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing pause server policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I9eb4d7f348481425992713bd5a0351d710d43669
'}]
commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing pause server policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing pause server policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I9eb4d7f348481425992713bd5a0351d710d43669
