commit_message:
Release final octavia-lib for ussuri

Final ussuri non-client lib release for the April 2 deadline.

Please leave +1 if we are all set and can proceed. Leave -1 if we
need to wait a little bit longer for something final to land,
then update it with a better commit hash to use for the release
when ready.

Patches with no response will be approved a few days after the
deadline.

Change-Id: Icf34519beca21e3959ad957b05e08b63a94216d1
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update hacking for Python3

The repo is Python 3 now, so update hacking to version 3.0 which
supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking and friends from lower-constraints, it's not needed
there.

Change-Id: I48fcd2521d99d0b77b976e87cc638fe5ac051315

commit_message:
Use rally-openstack 1.7.0 for stable/queens

Master branch now has requirements incompatible with stable branches
constraints [0], so this switches to last tag compatible.

Longer term fix will be to run rally in a virtualenv, but this is lower
priority than other tasks. This can be revisited at the time, though for
older branches we will probably stick with pinned version

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack/commit/5776e015f16321fdb489ebb482d984ccd3cd2903

Change-Id: I54fb021dec49724f17e7b5a330e09bcc638310d6
Closes-Bug: #1868691

commit_message:
Add TLS protocols for listener and pool model

Parameter added to the listener and pool model for TLS protocols.
Constants TLS_VERSIONS, SSL_VERSION_3, TLS_VERSION_1,
TLS_VERSION_1_1, TLS_VERSION_1_2, and TLS_VERSION_1_3 were added.

Change-Id: Ie54640201a0f4905d19841af5913972646b317bf
Co-authored-by: Steven Glasford <stevenglasford@gmail.com>
Story: 2006733
Task: 37186

This policy is default to SYSTEM_READER role.

fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-hypervisors policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-hypervisors API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_READER role.

Policy rules are made more granular to adopt the new defaults.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I548e49bd3e51eb51de922e97f3340363b8b94e50

commit_message:
Fix pyScss version in lower-constraints.txt

Horizon requires  pyScss>=1.3.7 [1] but lower-constraints.txt
in ironic-ui uses pyScss 1.3.4 which can cause the
failure in future. So this patch update pyScss version in
lower-constraints.txt to sync the change.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/715241/

Change-Id: Ia1e6b4142a94f93cc28ed6ec8d0668492ea878e1

[{'created': '2020-03-31 23:53:59.000000000', 'message': 'Remove provisioned calculation on non thin provision backends

On those backends, there is no need to calculate provisioned_capacity_gb
as it is not used during the scheduling. This calculation was not
scaling properly on big environments as it implies many database
queries.

Change-Id: If1ea4ceedc495dc6c6e247feccfbdc4899ad725c
Closes-Bug: #1869712
(cherry picked from commit cd9292b931a0f74079512cd43652129a9c595ee8)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove provisioned calculation on non thin provision backends

On those backends, there is no need to calculate provisioned_capacity_gb
as it is not used during the scheduling. This calculation was not
scaling properly on big environments as it implies many database
queries.

Change-Id: If1ea4ceedc495dc6c6e247feccfbdc4899ad725c
Closes-Bug: #1869712
(cherry picked from commit cd9292b931a0f74079512cd43652129a9c595ee8)

[{'created': '2020-03-29 02:42:25.000000000', 'message': 'Correct limits policy check_str

limits API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1]
but API is allowed (which is expected) for everyone.

This is because API does not pass the project_id in policy
target so that oslo policy can decide the ownership[2]. If no
target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which
is nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone try to access)
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

There is no owner things in limits and every projects can get
its own limits. We need to make default to RULE_ANY which means
allowed to everyone.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/403fc671a6877889d6fb70360e002d9b22b98fc9/nova/policies/limits.py#L27
Closes-bug: #1869543

commit_message:
Correct limits policy check_str

limits API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1]
but API is allowed (which is expected) for everyone.

This is because API does not pass the project_id in policy
target so that oslo policy can decide the ownership[2]. If no
target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which
is nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone try to access)
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

There is no owner things in limits and every projects can get
its own limits. We need to make default to RULE_ANY which means
allowed to everyone.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/403fc671a6877889d6fb70360e002d9b22b98fc9/nova/policies/limits.py#L27
Closes-bug: #1869543

Change-Id: I80617e57a6e062e6038e1b3447e116a5f9e23d24

> (1 comment)

Thank you for the reference. My read of it is that the decision we reached at the midcycle, include only the changed properties in the PATCH request's data, is consistent with the standard.

Do you agree?"}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2020-03-05 21:53:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> Thank you for the reference. My read of it is that the decision we reached at the midcycle, include only the changed properties in the PATCH request's data, is consistent with the standard.

I think our uneducated belief at the mid-cycle has been that Redfish requires the use of RFC6902 [1] for document tree modification.

But then it turned out that Redfish assumes that missing attributes in PATCH just imply no change.

So this patch aligns sushy with the fishy spirit of the spec.

1. https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6902"}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2020-03-05 22:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2020-03-06 15:31:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Testing this now on Dell hardware'}, {'account_id': 26340, 'date': '2020-03-06 17:52:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 28533, 'date': '2020-03-09 12:55:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Just a general comment on how I would expect different Redfish services to behave.

Overall, I would not expect limitations on PATCHing multiple properties at once, except if certain properties are in conflict. One case that comes to mind with regards to the Boot object is if BootSourceOverrideTarget is UefiBootNext, then BootSourceOverrideEnabled cannot be Continuous. These cases should be called out in the schema descriptions, but it's entirely possible implementations have started enforcing other types of restrictions (the whole "Continuous" boot override seems to not be well liked in the UEFI group).

In terms of behavior with regards for the "Once" setting, the expectation is this is automatically disabled after the reboot/boot attempt.

A lot of this functionality stems from the old IPMI Set/Get System Boot Options commands, but we've been wedging in support for more types of targets (especially with regards to UEFI).'}, {'account_id': 28533, 'date': '2020-03-09 12:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

It might be worth checking out the rf_boot_override.py script here: https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish-Tacklebox

As well as the one_time_boot test here: https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish-Usecase-Checkers'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-03-23 20:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-03-23 20:43:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

> > (1 comment)
 > 
 > Thank you for the reference. My read of it is that the decision we
 > reached at the midcycle, include only the changed properties in the
 > PATCH request's data, is consistent with the standard.
 > 
 > Do you agree?

It looks like this is already being done which makes me confused by your current vote of -1. Perhaps I don't understand."}, {'account_id': 10250, 'date': '2020-03-30 22:49:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Hey guys, unfortunately our testing was conflated with setting the boot mode/device during deployment.  We're sorting that out and should have results for you soon.  Sorry for the delay."}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-04-01 18:03:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 15519, 'date': '2020-04-01 18:05:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 23847, 'date': '2020-04-01 18:17:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

I appreciate that this offers more granular application of boot override settings. Thank you, Ilya!'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 12:14:13.000000000', 'message': "Decouple `set_system_boot_source` parameters

Some BMC implementations do not support changing all attributes
of the Redfish `Boot` object. To address that, this patch makes
`set_system_boot_source` parameters all optional to allow for
more atomicity when PATCH'ing Redfish `Boot` object.

In the end, we should only include those items to the PATCH
document, that are explicitly passed by the user.

Change-Id: I4fa9f718de99def4da162acd4636a17d53ee9a51
Story: 2007355
Task: 38907
"}, {'created': '2020-03-03 13:49:19.000000000', 'message': "Decouple `set_system_boot_source` parameters

Some BMC implementations do not support changing all attributes
of the Redfish `Boot` object. To address that, this patch adds
a new `set_system_boot_options` method to the `System` object
superseding the set_system_boot_source` method. The new method has
all boot parameters optional to allow for more atomicity when PATCH'ing
Redfish `Boot` object. The new method will only include those items in
the PATCH document, that are explicitly passed by the user. This change
might improve interoperability with BMCs that do not handle certain
attributes of the `Boot` object.

Change-Id: I4fa9f718de99def4da162acd4636a17d53ee9a51
Story: 2007355
Task: 38907
"}, {'created': '2020-03-03 15:00:36.000000000', 'message': "Add `set_system_boot_options` method

Some BMC implementations do not support changing all attributes
of the Redfish `Boot` object. To address that, this patch adds
a new `set_system_boot_options` method to the `System` object
superseding the set_system_boot_source` method.

The new method has all boot parameters optional to allow for
more atomicity when PATCH'ing Redfish `Boot` object. When
sending HTTP PATCH request, this new method will only include
those items into the JSON document, that are explicitly passed
by the user.

This change might improve interoperability with BMCs that do
not handle certain attributes of the `Boot` object.

Change-Id: I4fa9f718de99def4da162acd4636a17d53ee9a51
Story: 2007355
Task: 38907
"}, {'created': '2020-03-05 14:38:36.000000000', 'message': "Add `set_system_boot_options` method

Some BMC implementations do not support changing all attributes
of the Redfish `Boot` object. To address that, this patch adds
a new `set_system_boot_options` method to the `System` object
superseding the set_system_boot_source` method.

The new method has all boot parameters optional to allow for
more atomicity when PATCH'ing Redfish `Boot` object. When
sending HTTP PATCH request, this new method will only include
those items into the JSON document, that are explicitly passed
by the user.

This change might improve interoperability with BMCs that do
not handle certain attributes of the `Boot` object.

Change-Id: I4fa9f718de99def4da162acd4636a17d53ee9a51
Story: 2007355
Task: 38907
"}]
commit_message:
Add `set_system_boot_options` method

Some BMC implementations do not support changing all attributes
of the Redfish `Boot` object. To address that, this patch adds
a new `set_system_boot_options` method to the `System` object
superseding the set_system_boot_source` method.

The new method has all boot parameters optional to allow for
more atomicity when PATCH'ing Redfish `Boot` object. When
sending HTTP PATCH request, this new method will only include
those items into the JSON document, that are explicitly passed
by the user.

This change might improve interoperability with BMCs that do
not handle certain attributes of the `Boot` object.

Change-Id: I4fa9f718de99def4da162acd4636a17d53ee9a51
Story: 2007355
Task: 38907

commit_message:
Use rally-openstack 1.7.0 for stable/rocky

Master branch now has requirements incompatible with stable branches
constraints [0], so this switches to last tag compatible.

Longer term fix will be to run rally in a virtualenv, but this is lower
priority than other tasks. This can be revisited at the time, though for
older branches we will probably stick with pinned version

Also pin neutron-tempest-plugin to latest version that supports python 2

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack/commit/5776e015f16321fdb489ebb482d984ccd3cd2903

Change-Id: I54fb021dec49724f17e7b5a330e09bcc638310d6
Closes-Bug: #1868691

[{'created': '2020-04-01 17:05:34.000000000', 'message': "scan the whole branch if a version cannot be found

Instead of throwing an error when we can't find a version tag, scan
the whole branch. This avoids a class of failures that come up when
building the release notes cache for all branches during sdist
packaging.

Change-Id: I24617ad33852fd604650edbf03dc55e0319581ee
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
scan the whole branch if a version cannot be found

Instead of throwing an error when we can't find a version tag, scan
the whole branch. This avoids a class of failures that come up when
building the release notes cache for all branches during sdist
packaging.

Change-Id: I24617ad33852fd604650edbf03dc55e0319581ee
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

I need help with this. Once, I was able to reproduce the py36-etcd3 timeout with patch set 2, and thought I fixed the problem in PS3. I am no longer able to reproduce the problem, in either PS2 or PS3.

I compared the test results between my own successful py36-etcd3 run, with the most recent failure [1], which timed out. The actual test results are identical.
- The same number of tests are executed
- The results of each test are identical (same ones are ok or skipped)

It appears the full set of py36-etcd3 tests ran to completion, everything passed or was properly skipped, but then something hung when it should have summarized the results.

I'm at a loss about what to do, and could use some help.

[1] https://57a61a8afab2e221420e-617ef7fbad3f3b279f2e56581b296bd4.ssl.cf2.rackcdn.com/710539/3/check/tooz-tox-py36-etcd3/40501d0/job-output.txt"}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-03-24 15:52:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-03-24 15:53:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Experimenting to see if removing the test_etcd3.py file (which I added) affects CI.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-24 17:17:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-03-24 18:03:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I'll see if I can hack something together."}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2020-03-27 19:57:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2020-03-27 19:59:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Oops I accidentally lost the changes from rev#5, will re-add that.  This hack seems to work for me locally.'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2020-03-27 20:02:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-03-27 20:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-03-27 22:04:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-30 10:44:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 11356, 'date': '2020-03-30 10:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-03-30 20:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

Is the deadlock issue limited to the unit tests or is it something people would hit in production too? If the latter then I think we should bump the minimum version of etcd3 in setup.cfg: https://github.com/openstack/tooz/blob/master/setup.cfg#L50

That would allow us to remove the workaround in the test code too.'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2020-03-30 20:25:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9257, 'date': '2020-03-30 20:30:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> Is the deadlock issue limited to the unit tests or is it something
 > people would hit in production too? If the latter then I think we
 > should bump the minimum version of etcd3 in setup.cfg:
 > https://github.com/openstack/tooz/blob/master/setup.cfg#L50
 > 
 > That would allow us to remove the workaround in the test code too.

It's certainly more likely to happen in the tests.  In production I could see it causing the service to maybe hang during shutdown.  In the tests it's happening as the python interpreter is finalizing everything at exit.

The only reason I added the workaround in the tests was as a stopgap until we get a new upstream etcd3 release.  But as Louis offered above, a quicker new upstream release would mean we can drop the workaround and just update the minimum required version."}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:57:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-04-01 14:17:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2020-04-01 16:59:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

I had a few second thoughts about the version bump after requesting it because changing deps late in the cycle is a little unkind to our packagers, but it's still a ways from the Ussuri release date so hopefully they'll have plenty of time to deal with it."}]

commit_message:
Add TLS support in etcd3 and etcd3gw drivers

The etcd3 and etcd3gw drivers parse CA, key and cert options from
the coordination URL, and pass them on to the backend clients. The
etcd3gw driver implements the "etcd3+https" scheme.

Change-Id: I78d8ca0583f883f7f746791f82fbcc116458ce2c

commit_message:
Include tripleo_generate_scripts for undercloud install

Includes a configuration option to output a shell script that can be
used to rerun the undercloud installation without ansible.

Change-Id: I8b64989f0ddc98d495b7c015a9bd05999cf59188

commit_message:
Use OVN mech driver OVSDB connections for l3 plugin

It is possible to re-use the mech driver ovsdb connections in the
ovn l3 plugin, saving the overhead of two db connections/in-memory
copies of the db per process.

Closes-Bug: #1864548
Change-Id: I022dea485f42cf76c4cec67ee43eed9a3770ec9c

subject: Expose --limit, --skip-tags, and --tags in config-download.
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 14:41:22.000000000', 'message': 'Expose --limit, --skip-tags, and --tags in config-download.

and using them during config-download (during the deploy and update

commit_message:
Expose --limit, --skip-tags, and --tags in config-download.

The Mistral workflows can now consume these ansible-playbook arguments
and using them during config-download (during the deploy and update
only). Separate arguments align with the new Ansible Runner which cannot
accept any arbitrary or random argument.

Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ibb3feb21a276c52b68f61e9dcb739de14bb111cd
(cherry picked from commit 1c7c18d807258fff5ee2434d2d089940088556b6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 17:05:35.000000000', 'message': 'Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1f2a1b8de81c5b8cd86881d591b76a7d6e62a5e5
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX/UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I1f2a1b8de81c5b8cd86881d591b76a7d6e62a5e5

commit_message:
Allow specifying target devices for software RAID

This change adds support for the physical_disks RAID parameter in
a form of device hints (same as for root device selection).

Change-Id: I9751ab0f86ada41e3b668670dc112d58093b8099
Story: #2006369
Task: #39080

commit_message:
Install pymemcache explicitly

The pymemcache package is needed by ironic-inspector-api process
when running in non-standalone mode.
Since devstack doesn't install test-requirements anymore, we need
to force installation in the devstack plugin before the inspector
processes start.

Change-Id: Iff0de5eb99db4a3dcb0d5ff09b908484f9532492

commit_message:
Update master for stable/ussuri

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/ussuri.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/ussuri.

Change-Id: I7218e0a5f04ca02f0111343f152da52f37d8ea3a
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
Using podman/docker ps to look for running sidecars

We've been running into numerous issues with searching on patterns in
the command so using the container CLI to match seems better.

Change-Id: I13633ab4d5ebfc7f52b7215523c310fe72a5487e
Closes-Bug: #1869384

commit_message:
Remove provisioned calculation on non thin provision backends

On those backends, there is no need to calculate provisioned_capacity_gb
as it is not used during the scheduling. This calculation was not
scaling properly on big environments as it implies many database
queries.

Change-Id: If1ea4ceedc495dc6c6e247feccfbdc4899ad725c
Closes-Bug: #1869712

commit_message:
Use rally-openstack 1.7.0 for stable/stein

Master branch now has requirements incompatible with stable branches
constraints [0], so this switches to last tag compatible.

Longer term fix will be to run rally in a virtualenv, but this is lower
priority than other tasks. This can be revisited at the time, though for
older branches we will probably stick with pinned version

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack/commit/5776e015f16321fdb489ebb482d984ccd3cd2903

Change-Id: Iba1da7b4214d98bc1500ea57ed1faade423adf31
Closes-Bug: #1868691
(cherry picked from commit 2a8af5f1659e8fd64923943a9db4698f94746e0a)

supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 19:10:23.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in os-hypervisors

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-hypervisors API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Id073345857fa26a0522804de42a133c588450330
"}, {'created': '2020-03-30 15:22:19.000000000', 'message': "Introduce scope_types in os-hypervisors

commit_message:
Introduce scope_types in os-hypervisors

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for os-hypervisors API policies
as 'system'.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: Id073345857fa26a0522804de42a133c588450330

commit_message:
Fix unpause server policy to be admin_or_owner

unpause server API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716161/

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1869841
Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1]
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/eb6bd04e4c27c70b5239dbe7c17607b37f4e87dd/nova/policies/pause_server.py#L38
[2]
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/eb6bd04e4c27c70b5239dbe7c17607b37f4e87dd/nova/api/openstack/compute/pause_server.py#L58
[3]
- https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: Iacfaec63eb380863657b44c7f5ff14f6209e3857

commit_message:
Add new default roles in pause server policies

This adds new defaults roles in pause server API policies.
- pause/unpause policies are default to system admin or project member.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I300aa42fbe6e87dafdb1459fc2daf96fd36acd1a

Introduce scope_types in pause server policy

oslo.policy introduced the scope_type feature which can
control the access level at system-level and project-level.
 - https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.policy/latest/user/usage.html#setting-scope
 - http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/keystone-specs/specs/keystone/queens/system-scope.html

Appropriate scope_type for nova case:
- https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/ussuri/approved/policy-defaults-refresh.html#scope

This commit introduce scope_type for pause server API policies
as:
- ['system', 'project'] for pause/unpause policy.

Also adds the test case with scope_type enabled and verify we
pass and fail the policy check with expected context.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing lock server policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing lock server policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I4de714cc988e8dc25209869c28268ef390a12d33

commit_message:
Fix unlock server policy to be admin_or_owner

unlock server API policy is default to admin_or_owner[1] but API
is allowed for everyone.

We can see the test trying with other project context can access the API
- https://review.opendev.org/#/c/716057/

This is because API does not pass the server project_id in policy target[2]
and if no target is passed then, policy.py add the default targets which is
nothing but context.project_id (allow for everyone who try to access)[3]

This commit fix this policy by passing the server's project_id in policy
target.

Closes-bug: #1869791
Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/7b51647f17c88c7c1ae321c59ab8a98c586d4b67/nova/policies/lock_server.py#L38
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a534ccc5a7dbe687277d9233883f500ec635fe04/nova/api/openstack/compute/lock_server.py#L46
[3] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/c16315165ce307c605cf4b608b2df3aa06f46982/nova/policy.py#L191

Change-Id: I84dd0edd89d9c9d58f3136d90becc07d44c9b39a

commit_message:
Disable podman_container concurrency in generate-config

In that step, we archive config_volumes; which is a risky operation
if some containers have different config volumes but share some common
bind mount volumes (e.g. in /var/lib). To prevent 2 containers (or more)
which would share a same bind mount to run at the same time, let's
run them in serial without concurrency. It'll be a bit slower, but
without race condition risk when container-puppet.sh is executed.

Change-Id: I63dadaa7f71bc130d925b405acac24a035863deb
Related-Bug: #1868934

commit_message:
container-puppet.sh: lock archived dirs during archiving

This patch will prevent multiple containers to archive the same
directory at the same time during the execution of container-puppet.sh.

It'll simply creates a lock file for each directory and releases it
at the end of archiving. If another container tries to archives the same
directory, it'll wait up to 5 minutes that the directory is free.

Change-Id: I40ebe11573d53daaac742ca4a53f119bfc83cb7f
Related-Bug: #1868934

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing migrations policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing migrations policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I3e4cc2ee6ffa80fa19739fd6d4039edb9dd86ed9

commit_message:
Add new default roles in os-flavor-access policies

This adds new defaults roles in os-flavor-access API policies.
This policy is default to SYSTEM_ADMIN role for add/remove
tenant access and SYSTEM_READER for list the access information.

Also add tests to simulates the future where we drop the deprecation
fall back in the policy by overriding the rules with a version where
there are no deprecated rule options. Operators can do the same by
adding overrides in their policy files that match the default but
stop the rule deprecation fallback from happening.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Closes-Bug: #1867840

Change-Id: Ieeaafe923b78f03ddcbec18d8759aa1d76bcfcb1

[{'created': '2020-03-31 04:36:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add test coverage of existing migrate server policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing migrate server policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I1de770bd17d3b8bd2e4f3381ae73a1f6cdf30c80

commit_message:
Add test coverage of existing migrate server policies

Current tests do not have good test coverage of existing policies.
Either tests for policies do not exist or if they exist then they
do not cover the actual negative and positive testing.

For Example, if any policy with default rule as admin only then
test should verify:
- policy check pass with context having admin or server owner
- policy check fail with context having non-admin and not server owner

As discussed in policy-defaults-refresh, to change the policies
with new default roles and scope_type, we need to have the enough
testing coverage of existing policy behavior.

When we will add the scope_type in policies or new default roles,
then these test coverage will be extended to adopt the new changes
and also make sure we do not break the existing behavior.

This commit covers the testing coverage of existing migrate server policies.

Partial implement blueprint policy-defaults-refresh

Change-Id: I1de770bd17d3b8bd2e4f3381ae73a1f6cdf30c80

commit_message:
config-download timeout should KILL the process.

The timeout command defaults to using TERM which does
not always ensure that it will end soon enough. The
ansible-playbook command should end as soon as possible.

Change-Id: I0f97772434040f04f9495239b9a432c1ac062555
Closes-Bug: #1867968
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7be36f305107c0bfb4e403f5df4226635e34dffa)
(cherry picked from commit 9faf10dd844b13d002b0d16413935fceae46ed4e)
(cherry picked from commit c9cced6131113a0946f5a0ccd676b60b7ed0bcb6)

commit_message:
Move ipmi logging to a separate option

The IPMI verbose output being turned on by the debug option
is confusing and misleading, and since many operators run
ironic in debug mode anyway, it doesn't make much sense
to spam logs with errors and information that can be
misleading to a less experienced operator.

Also... less logging output.

Change-Id: I0fae7bad5613865dfd4d1c663be08d40debe157a

commit_message:
vexxhost: load base-jobs & project-config pipelines

With the previous change, we stopped having pipeline configuration
loaded inside the vexxhost tenant, this restores the pipelines.

Change-Id: I8fa6160b4694b93434d269973f95de8ed3ccd180

commit_message:
Update peers with API addresses

Use default_update_peers which will publish admin, internal and public
addresses to peers.

Change-Id: Icf242fefbae99682aae2e666c246ac94edeb3f39

commit_message:
Add module to output scripts

In CI and other environments, we leave shell scripts for reproducing the
commands that were run. This change adds a tripleo_shell_script module
that will take the command and environment and write out a script that
represents what would be run by the ansible tasks.

Change-Id: Ie3d3a57723db3f7d5f1896b455ac703a06e97aac

commit_message:
Split out cache configuration to keystone::cache

Add the new class keystone::cache to manage all configurations for
cache, so that we can reduce the complexity of init.pp .

Change-Id: I0062829d05697ad2159e21458dfb8826853693e1

commit_message:
Drop use of admin-token in tests

The keystone charm no longer supports the use of the admin-token;
drop its use in the barbican charm functional test suite.

Lowercase domain names when matching to deal with 'Default' as
setup by the new keystone bootstrap process.

Change-Id: Iee2091941d614aa803366e6f5c04d00909f7b1b3
TODO: rewrite tests using Zaza

commit_message:
Make mock import python 2.7 compatible

In python3.x mock is now part of unittest library.
For being still compatible with python 2.7 we need to
catch import error when trying to import unittest.mock

Change-Id: I6aca21bea4f1563e1f3c5ecfb91c511191eb409b

commit_message:
Expect python3 client package in CentOS8

In CentOS, we expect to have python3 client package in 8.x while we
expect to have python2 in 7.x .
Fix unit tests to expect the correct version according to os major
version.

Note that this patch also removes broken unit tests which overrides
os release information to test el6 and el7.

Change-Id: I3692a2015ccaa79acd69679e0c749d9d6fa78bcb

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-09-26 14:37:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

The three deps are from the same project, so IIUC zuul will only pay attention to the last one. You can see that here [1] and confirm by searching that log for either of the other change numbers.

What's mystifying to me is that we're nevertheless seeing the changes from [2], e.g. the [nova] section in cyborg.conf [3], which wouldn't be there otherwise.

And I see cyborg creating the device in placement [4][5] and notifying nova [6][7] which means stuff is working. I just don't understand how, given the above.

[1] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/83a76cc61a524884884c39b331a8bb5f/log/job-output.txt#806
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/682565/
[3] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/83a76cc61a524884884c39b331a8bb5f/log/controller/logs/etc/cyborg/cyborg_conf.txt.gz#45-52
[4] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/83a76cc61a524884884c39b331a8bb5f/log/controller/logs/screen-cyborg-cond.txt.gz#287-289
[5] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/83a76cc61a524884884c39b331a8bb5f/log/controller/logs/screen-placement-api.txt.gz#278-280
[6] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/83a76cc61a524884884c39b331a8bb5f/log/controller/logs/screen-cyborg-api.txt.gz#607
[7] https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/83a76cc61a524884884c39b331a8bb5f/log/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz#1877-1880"}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-26 17:30:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

> The three deps are from the same project, so IIUC zuul will only
 > pay attention to the last one.

The Zuul documentation [1] states:
    A change may list more than one dependency by simply adding more Depends-On: lines.
There is no stated restriction of only one per project.

So the simplest explanation would be that Zuul pulled in all 3 but chose to log only the last one.

A previous run with 4 dependencies (patchset 13) had also succeeded. So, this is not an one-off.

[1] https://zuul-ci.org/docs/zuul/user/gating.html#dependencies 
    under Section "Multiple Changes"'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-09-26 18:57:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Looking closer, the log is just mentioning a commit hash and title, and I can't find wherever it's building up what's in that commit. Clearly it's doing the right thing based on the other evidence."}, {'account_id': 21672, 'date': '2019-09-27 05:08:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14:

'}, {'created': '2019-08-15 11:12:10.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] add cyborg tempest job

This patch adds cyborg-tempest job, which does the End-to-end scenario tests:
1) create device_profile f1,
a 'flavor' in cyborg to describe requested accelertors
2) nova merge device_profile f1 into a nova flavor f2
3) create VM with the newly-merged flavor f2

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667231/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665318/

Change-Id: Id8762d0d95aa7c90feee64eb07a50433ca6ca3d1
"}, {'created': '2019-08-16 05:55:07.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] add cyborg tempest job

The nova-cyborg interaction (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/603955/15) 
features are still work in progress. The features include create 
and manage instances with accelerators, and the changes needed in Nova
to accomplish that.
This patch adds cyborg-tempest job to do the End-to-end scenario tests
for nova-cyborg interaction features:
1) create device_profile f1,
a 'flavor' in cyborg to describe requested accelertors
2) nova merge device_profile f1 into a nova flavor f2
3) create VM with the newly-merged flavor f2

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/667231/
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/665318/

Change-Id: Id8762d0d95aa7c90feee64eb07a50433ca6ca3d1

commit_message:
Add cyborg tempest job.

The Cyborg tempest plugin has been merged in Train [1]. The
creation and deletion of VMs with this patch series are
validated with that plugin.

The plugin is being enhanced to cover other VM operations like
reboots, pause, etc. [2]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cyborg-tempest-plugin
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/685183/

Change-Id: Id8762d0d95aa7c90feee64eb07a50433ca6ca3d1
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-30 22:38:40.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for clear_foreign_config() unsupported on some controllers

iDRAC driver fails to clear foreign drives on some controllers
and returns  message_id ``STOR058`` which means controllers does
not support clear_foreign_config operation.

Change-Id: I7df2d30242e7a490dfdce04d7f6ce98c68e9f0ed
(cherry picked from commit 8394938d2f72dbadb4ebf7a95c1973216cd8dd3a)
'}, {'created': '2020-03-30 22:41:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for clear_foreign_config() unsupported on some controllers

and returns  message_id ``STOR058`` which means controllers does

'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 11:58:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for clear_foreign_config() unsupported on some controllers

iDRAC driver fails to clear foreign drives on some controllers

commit_message:
Fix for clear_foreign_config() unsupported on some controllers

iDRAC driver fails to clear foreign drives on some controllers
and returns  message_id ``STOR058`` which means controllers does
not support clear_foreign_config operation.

Change-Id: I7df2d30242e7a490dfdce04d7f6ce98c68e9f0ed
(cherry picked from commit 8394938d2f72dbadb4ebf7a95c1973216cd8dd3a)

commit_message:
Ensure the the ceph keyring is not None

If we try to render the Ceph configuration while
key is None, this raises an exception as it expects
a str

Change-Id: Ie1cc8252035336d377a63e8cf51600ec3a59412b
Closes-Bug: #1869989

commit_message:
Fix return correct cache when reusing port

The patch fixes issue when the same port is requested for multiple
instances and second one can't get metadata due to cached instance_id.

Closes-Bug: 1868867

commit_message:
Check volume endpoint availability in the same order

cinder microversion check (api.cinder.get_microversion) checks
volume endpoint availability in a different order as cinderclient()
does. It does not API_VERSIONS setting in horizon.
As a result, when multiple volume endpoints are configured,
get_microversion() accesses a volume endpoint with a different API
version. At the moment cinder v2 and v3 APIs returns the same info,
so it only affects when cinder v1 endpoint is configured.

This commit introduces a new function _find_cinder_url() to
retrieve a volume endpoint considering API_VERSIONS.

get_auth_params_from_request() is no longer needed and the variable
substitutions are now backed to cinderclient(). It was introduced
so that the memoized decorator worked but the memoized decorator
was improved and we no longer need it.

Change-Id: I69b1fc11caf8a78c49e98aba6c538e5f344b14f2
Closes-Bug: #1864133
(cherry picked from commit 4b31ae5063e4392ecf964ffaae15a30bf97ddedc)

commit_message:
Update pyScss to 1.3.7

pyScss 1.3.4 is not compatible with setuptools 46.
pyScss 1.3.7 was releaed to make it work with setuptools 46.

Note that a workaround for the material design theme
in commit ddc52a7405f0be38629f665d24bcf75022ce0018 is not backported
in this change as the workaround is a partial fix of bug 1771559.
Instead, a release note to mention this as a known issue is added.

python-memcached in test-requirements.txt is updated to
pass the requirements-check job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/716023
Change-Id: I336a3449c1ed8be3984da6366e9b45f8e4d3f5c0
(cherry picked from commit 2c44702724f25c8114e1a7318d45cd0f87a6c131)
(cherry picked from commit dbda462982d694b88ecacbe78da85bcc37868548)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-04-01 00:11:00.000000000', 'message': "vexxhost: move base-jobs to config-project

Inside the VEXXHOST tenant, we have a need to be able to use build
Docker images in many different places.  Therefore, we need the
ability to have secrets inside of a repository which other repos
can just use the jobs for, avoiding the need of encrypting the
Docker credentials for every single repository.

However, due to the current limitation in Zuul, it's not possible
to accomplish this without having a config-project, and by being
a config-project, that provides an elevated set of access.  As
an interim solution until Zuul has the ability to do this without
using a config-project, this change makes the project a config
project however changes the ACLs to include project-config-core.

The rationale was that I (mnaser) is already part of that group
and therefore this wouldn't be providing me any more access to
make changes to config projects.  This would be an interim solution
until we're able to do this natively with Zuul and the ACLs can
return to VEXXHOST.

Change-Id: I6baefcae3e23767aeeaa2d572b1a17fd2aa5ebe6
"}, {'created': '2020-04-01 02:53:41.000000000', 'message': "vexxhost: move base-jobs to config-project

Inside the VEXXHOST tenant, we have a need to be able to use build
Docker images in many different places.  Therefore, we need the
ability to have secrets inside of a repository which other repos
can just use the jobs for, avoiding the need of encrypting the
Docker credentials for every single repository.

However, due to the current limitation in Zuul, it's not possible
to accomplish this without having a config-project, and by being
a config-project, that provides an elevated set of access.  As
an interim solution until Zuul has the ability to do this without
using a config-project, this change makes the project a config
project however changes the ACLs to include project-config-core.

The rationale was that I (mnaser) is already part of that group
and therefore this wouldn't be providing me any more access to
make changes to config projects.  This would be an interim solution
until we're able to do this natively with Zuul and the ACLs can
return to VEXXHOST.

In this change, we also move opendev/project-config to only load
jobs, secrets and nodesets and to avoid loading the project so we
don't end up reporting to changes to opendev/project-config.

Change-Id: I6baefcae3e23767aeeaa2d572b1a17fd2aa5ebe6
"}]
commit_message:
vexxhost: move base-jobs to config-project

Inside the VEXXHOST tenant, we have a need to be able to use build
Docker images in many different places.  Therefore, we need the
ability to have secrets inside of a repository which other repos
can just use the jobs for, avoiding the need of encrypting the
Docker credentials for every single repository.

However, due to the current limitation in Zuul, it's not possible
to accomplish this without having a config-project, and by being
a config-project, that provides an elevated set of access.  As
an interim solution until Zuul has the ability to do this without
using a config-project, this change makes the project a config
project however changes the ACLs to include project-config-core.

The rationale was that I (mnaser) is already part of that group
and therefore this wouldn't be providing me any more access to
make changes to config projects.  This would be an interim solution
until we're able to do this natively with Zuul and the ACLs can
return to VEXXHOST.

In this change, we also move opendev/project-config to only load
jobs, secrets and nodesets and to avoid loading the project so we
don't end up reporting to changes to opendev/project-config.

Change-Id: I6baefcae3e23767aeeaa2d572b1a17fd2aa5ebe6

[{'created': '2020-03-31 14:30:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix CONFIGS=None issue with action openstack-upgrade

When the CONFIGS was made lazy in the charm, unfortunately, some of the
work wasn't carried through correctly to the openstack-upgrade action
code.  This patch corrects that.  Tested manually as okay.

Change-Id: I095613ef2eca62da5fae5462e76fa83926d2e80a
Closes-Bug: #1869865
"}]
commit_message:
Fix CONFIGS=None issue with action openstack-upgrade

When the CONFIGS was made lazy in the charm, unfortunately, some of the
work wasn't carried through correctly to the openstack-upgrade action
code.  This patch corrects that.  Tested manually as okay.

Change-Id: I095613ef2eca62da5fae5462e76fa83926d2e80a
Closes-Bug: #1869865

'}, {'created': '2020-04-01 12:26:16.000000000', 'message': 'Be more defensive when checking Vault

When relations are departing during a unit removal, the relation
to Vault can loose enough data that the vault-relation-departed hook
raises an exception. The checks for Vault readiness should be more
defensive to ensure that charms can successfully depart their relations

Depends-On https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/445
Closes-Bug: #1868282

Change-Id: I0b6226f0f3500aef7304f8e8b38d06daebfd0c20
'}]
commit_message:
Be more defensive when checking Vault

When relations are departing during a unit removal, the relation
to Vault can loose enough data that the vault-relation-departed hook
raises an exception. The checks for Vault readiness should be more
defensive to ensure that charms can successfully depart their relations

Depends-On https://github.com/juju/charm-helpers/pull/445
Closes-Bug: #1868282

Change-Id: I0b6226f0f3500aef7304f8e8b38d06daebfd0c20

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-24 19:19:53.000000000', 'message': 'Add undercloud-ipa-install to playbooks

This adds a play that registers the undercloud node with an existing IPA
server that is defined either with ansible vars or by exporting
environment variables as follows:

  - ipa_domain: domain of IPA server
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_domain
    environment_var: IPA_DOMAIN

  - ipa_realm: realm of IPA server (defaults to uppercase ipa_domain)
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_realm
    environment_var: IPA_REALM

  - ipa_server_user: username of IPA principal to use when registering
    undercloud node
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_admin_user
    environment_var: IPA_ADMIN_USER

  - ipa_server_password: password for IPA principal to use when
    registering undercloud node
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_admin_password
    environment_var: IPA_ADMIN_PASSWORD

  - ipa_server_hostname: hostname of IPA server to use
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_server_hostname
    environment_var: IPA_SERVER_HOSTNAME

  - undercloud_fqdn: FQDN of undercloud node being registered
    ansible_var: tripleo_undercloud_fqdn
    environment_var: UNDERCLOUD_FQDN

  - ansible_user: ansible user to run ipaclient tasks as, defaults to
    current user
    ansible_var: tripleo_ansible_user
    environment_var: USER

  - cloud_domain: domain name of the undercloud
    ansible_var: tripleo_cloud_domain
    environment_var: CLOUD_DOMAIN

Change-Id: I1792b124852af83c85857b41740de5fa014c7075

commit_message:
Add undercloud-ipa-install to playbooks

This adds a play that registers the undercloud node with an existing IPA
server that is defined either with ansible vars or by exporting
environment variables as follows:

  - ipa_domain: domain of IPA server
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_domain
    environment_var: IPA_DOMAIN

  - ipa_realm: realm of IPA server (defaults to uppercase ipa_domain)
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_realm
    environment_var: IPA_REALM

  - ipa_server_user: username of IPA principal to use when registering
    undercloud node
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_admin_user
    environment_var: IPA_ADMIN_USER

  - ipa_server_password: password for IPA principal to use when
    registering undercloud node
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_admin_password
    environment_var: IPA_ADMIN_PASSWORD

  - ipa_server_hostname: hostname of IPA server to use
    ansible_var: tripleo_ipa_server_hostname
    environment_var: IPA_SERVER_HOSTNAME

  - undercloud_fqdn: FQDN of undercloud node being registered
    ansible_var: tripleo_undercloud_fqdn
    environment_var: UNDERCLOUD_FQDN

  - ansible_user: ansible user to run ipaclient tasks as, defaults to
    current user
    ansible_var: tripleo_ansible_user
    environment_var: USER

  - cloud_domain: domain name of the undercloud
    ansible_var: tripleo_cloud_domain
    environment_var: CLOUD_DOMAIN

* Add no_log: True to tasks which may expose passwords to the logs

Change-Id: I1792b124852af83c85857b41740de5fa014c7075

Update peers with API addresses

Use default_update_peers which will publish admin, internal and public
addresses to peers.

Closes-Bug: #1858132

subject: Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes
messages: [{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-01-18 07:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-01-19 13:47:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 20778, 'date': '2020-04-01 13:40:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/stein as commit 2d9486adc0d60c522dc8c0ff3d8b443c9db396f2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-18 07:46:41.000000000', 'message': 'Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes

Currently an HA deployment making use of PacemakerRemote for any HA role
will fail with the following:
2020-01-16 08:40:22.707 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Start container mysql_restart_bundle as mysql_restart_bundle.
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Path seperator found in volume (/etc/corosync/corosync.conf), but did not exist on the file system
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] /etc/corosync/corosync.conf is not a valid volume source
...
2020-01-16 08:40:53.026 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] The following containers failed validations and were not started: mysql_restart_bundle

The reason for this is that via I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45 (HA: fix
<service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow), we consolidated
all the restart bundles into a single place inside
containers-common.yaml but we forgot to conditionalize the inclusion of
the /etc/corosync/corosync.conf bind mount. In fact this bind mount is
not needed since we started using RHEL/CentOS 8 (i.e. since the podman
introduction). See I399098bf734aa3b2862e1713d4b1f429d180afbc (Fix pcmk
remote podman bundle restarts) for more context

Tested in a composable HA deployment where the Messaging and the
Database roles were using PacemakerRemote and correctly deployed the
environment (which would previously fail):
[root@messaging-0 ~]# crm_mon -1 |grep -e database -e messaging
RemoteOnline: [ database-0 database-1 database-2 messaging-0 messaging-1 messaging-2 ]
 database-0     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 database-1     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 database-2     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 messaging-0    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 messaging-1    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 messaging-2    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 galera-bundle-0      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-0
 galera-bundle-1      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-1
 galera-bundle-2      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-2
 rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-0
 rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-1
 rabbitmq-bundle-2    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-2

Change-Id: I7766a75414bf8db75ccd233677e9ffe13ff28e23
Closes-Bug: #1859945
(cherry picked from commit a30342f253bf63db00a9545aebe50187b9c0324a)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix deployment on pacemaker remote nodes

Currently an HA deployment making use of PacemakerRemote for any HA role
will fail with the following:
2020-01-16 08:40:22.707 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Start container mysql_restart_bundle as mysql_restart_bundle.
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 DEBUG paunch [  ] Path seperator found in volume (/etc/corosync/corosync.conf), but did not exist on the file system
2020-01-16 08:40:22.708 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] /etc/corosync/corosync.conf is not a valid volume source
...
2020-01-16 08:40:53.026 33489 ERROR paunch [  ] The following containers failed validations and were not started: mysql_restart_bundle

The reason for this is that via I92d4ddf2feeac06ce14468ae928c283f3fd04f45 (HA: fix
<service>_restart_bundle with minor update workflow), we consolidated
all the restart bundles into a single place inside
containers-common.yaml but we forgot to conditionalize the inclusion of
the /etc/corosync/corosync.conf bind mount. In fact this bind mount is
not needed since we started using RHEL/CentOS 8 (i.e. since the podman
introduction). See I399098bf734aa3b2862e1713d4b1f429d180afbc (Fix pcmk
remote podman bundle restarts) for more context

Tested in a composable HA deployment where the Messaging and the
Database roles were using PacemakerRemote and correctly deployed the
environment (which would previously fail):
[root@messaging-0 ~]# crm_mon -1 |grep -e database -e messaging
RemoteOnline: [ database-0 database-1 database-2 messaging-0 messaging-1 messaging-2 ]
 database-0     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 database-1     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 database-2     (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 messaging-0    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-0
 messaging-1    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-1
 messaging-2    (ocf::pacemaker:remote):        Started controller-2
 galera-bundle-0      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-0
 galera-bundle-1      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-1
 galera-bundle-2      (ocf::heartbeat:galera):        Master database-2
 rabbitmq-bundle-0    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-0
 rabbitmq-bundle-1    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-1
 rabbitmq-bundle-2    (ocf::heartbeat:rabbitmq-cluster):      Started messaging-2

Change-Id: I7766a75414bf8db75ccd233677e9ffe13ff28e23
Closes-Bug: #1859945
(cherry picked from commit a30342f253bf63db00a9545aebe50187b9c0324a)

commit_message:
Pre-focal-enable by adding focal platform support

This patch preceeds the focal-enable patchset which adds the gate tests
for focal and ussuri targets.  This patch adds platform support for
running the charm on focal.

Change-Id: Id7345c36741e6c3a2b2ecc18ce1c076f43a7b721

subject: Fix tripleo_repos to handle components
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-31 19:22:59.000000000', 'message': 'Fix tripleo_repos to handle components

For centos8, we have componentized the openstack bits in RDO so we need
to fetch tripleo-repos from the tripleo component. This change will
properly identify the expected repo for tripleo-repos when not
installed.

Change-Id: I6ed72dd9166345f37191fce393488ae8f26a00b0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix tripleo_repos to handle components

For centos8, we have componentized the openstack bits in RDO so we need
to fetch tripleo-repos from the tripleo component. This change will
properly identify the expected repo for tripleo-repos when not
installed.

Change-Id: I6ed72dd9166345f37191fce393488ae8f26a00b0

commit_message:
Fix for clear_foreign_config() unsupported on some controllers

iDRAC driver fails to clear foreign drives on some controllers
and returns  message_id ``STOR058`` which means controllers does
not support clear_foreign_config operation.

Change-Id: I7df2d30242e7a490dfdce04d7f6ce98c68e9f0ed
(cherry picked from commit 8394938d2f72dbadb4ebf7a95c1973216cd8dd3a)

commit_message:
Blacklist stestr 2.3.0

This version has been blacklisted in global-requirements. It's not
likely that it will get used since pip will try to grab the latest, but
let's be explicit and make sure it never is.

Change-Id: I644926e6300f646b9ddc9ac4bdf0253caef18177
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-11 17:12:19.000000000', 'message': "Convert all of the fedora28 container usage to CentOS8

This change moves all of the fedora28 container images to centos8 to ensure
we're maximizing coverage in all of our roles with OS images that represent
real deployments. While fedora28 was useful to exercise RHEL8 code path's
while there was no RHEL/CentOS8 container image, we can now use the upstream
CentOS8 image ensuring we're getting a true, representative, environment.

Change-Id: I02f68b78fdf73a60443d8ea5d2dcb46e5ad67e25
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-03-12 08:25:01.000000000', 'message': "Convert all of the fedora28 container usage to CentOS8

The following molecule tests have been moved to non-voting as they are
facing some issues. A follow up patch will try to fix them ASAP.

- check_network_gateway (facing an issue when Ansible is trying to
  discover the python interpreter used in CentOS8 Docker Image)
- validate_selinux (facing a broken package dependencies issue while
  trying to install python3* package in CentOS8 Docker Image)

Change-Id: I02f68b78fdf73a60443d8ea5d2dcb46e5ad67e25
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Convert all of the fedora28 container usage to CentOS8

This change moves all of the fedora28 container images to centos8 to ensure
we're maximizing coverage in all of our roles with OS images that represent
real deployments. While fedora28 was useful to exercise RHEL8 code path's
while there was no RHEL/CentOS8 container image, we can now use the upstream
CentOS8 image ensuring we're getting a true, representative, environment.

The following molecule test has been moved to non-voting as it is
facing some issues. A follow up patch will try to fix them ASAP.

- check_network_gateway (facing an issue when Ansible is trying to
  discover the python interpreter used in CentOS8 Docker Image)

Change-Id: I02f68b78fdf73a60443d8ea5d2dcb46e5ad67e25
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-28 21:07:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove Nova parameters that are no longer used

Since Train release several puppet classes were removed
from puppet-nova. At the same time, some of them are
still defined in tripleo heat templates.

- nova::use_ipv6 was used to configure IPv6 for nova-network.
  DEFAULT/use_ipv6 nova configuration option was deprecated
  in Ocata release and removed from puppet-nova in Train
  release. Setting this parameter in THT no longer affects
  anything.
- nova::compute::neutron::libvirt_vif_driver seems like an
  artifact: though it was removed from puppet-nova only in
  Train release, actual nova configuration parameter was
  deprecated in IceHouse and hard-coded in Juno.

Puppet-nova change id: I6f7fde1f475acec82bafc66183211f317b4c7795

Change-Id: Ia269193f1f5215612165a2a0228bf4d1859b7b1e
Closes-Bug: #1869528
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Nova parameters that are no longer used

Since Train release several puppet classes were removed
from puppet-nova. At the same time, some of them are
still defined in tripleo heat templates.

- nova::use_ipv6 was used to configure IPv6 for nova-network.
  DEFAULT/use_ipv6 nova configuration option was deprecated
  in Ocata release and removed from puppet-nova in Train
  release. Setting this parameter in THT no longer affects
  anything.
- nova::compute::neutron::libvirt_vif_driver seems like an
  artifact: though it was removed from puppet-nova only in
  Train release, actual nova configuration parameter was
  deprecated in IceHouse and hard-coded in Juno.

Puppet-nova change id: I6f7fde1f475acec82bafc66183211f317b4c7795

Change-Id: Ia269193f1f5215612165a2a0228bf4d1859b7b1e
Closes-Bug: #1869528

commit_message:
Add default_backend cfg option to scenario tests

Glance config option glance_store.default_store is deprecated and will
be remove in the U cycle, default_backend is the suggested option for
it.
In neutron gate neutron-tempest-plugin-designate-scenario job fails
due to the issue with glance, the problem should be fixed in some base
job, but now let's see if this config addition really makes the job
passing.

Change-Id: I95afaf0dc9e86f59fc9039c70f13bc0a921d1077
Related-Bug: #1869862

We can't really add new deliverables that were not included in the train cycle originally. Can you provide a little more context on this?"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-30 14:59:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I agree with Sean, also you've some nits inline"}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-03-30 14:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> We can't really add new deliverables that were not included in the
 > train cycle originally. Can you provide a little more context on
 > this?

Hello Sean - of course, here are the info:
- this is part of the Validation Framework, which is a new way to run validations (for the records, they were to be launched via the UI, which has been deprecated since stein (or even earlier? not sure)).
- those "new" packages are a clean split of what we currently have in tripleoclient and part of the tripleo-validations content - the code itself isn't that new, more like a cleanup and refactoring

In addition, we have a need in OSP-16.1 (Red Hat OpenStack Platform). "unfortunately" this version will be based on stable/train - it would therefore need the upstream branch in order to be in a clean and consistent state, especially in order to avoid to do some ugly "downstream-only" patches within OSP code.

Does it answer your concerns? I fully understand them - but if this branching is refused, it will lead to a lot of trouble and inconsistency :/.

Feel free to ask for more details!'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-03-30 15:01:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-03-30 15:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(2 comments)

I suppose the corresponding code was removed from tripleoclient on train, can you confirm? If not It could be worth to release this drop too, to avoid confusion.

I'm not against introduce these new packages, if I'm right they are only used by RedHat so if RedHat ask for something specific in their product I don't see any reasons to refuse them if they know what they do downstream.

However I prefer to wait for Sean and Thierry feedbacks first.

I'll +2 if other release team cores members are ok with that.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-01 09:18:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I'm fine with granting an MembershipFreeze exception on this one as it is a cycle-trailing project"}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-01 09:18:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-01 09:19:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

Oh, misread that.. thought it was a ussuri thing. let me think about it a bit more'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2020-04-01 09:46:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So.. As Sean said, adding new deliverables to old OpenStack releases is a big no-no. For us it's akin to rewriting history and pretending it happened differently, confusing downstream consumers of the code as there is no way for us to communicate that type of change.

Obviously, here we have a corner case, since the only known downstream consumer of TripleO is the Red Hat product. It is unlikely that this change would create any confusion. The do-not-rewrite-history rule is part of a set of practices designed to enable multi-vendor projects, so they can appear weird in a single-vendor scenario.

We'll discuss this at the release meeting tomorrow, potentially punting to the TC for a final call. Personally I see three options on the table:

1- Granting an exception to the rule, recognizing it's a corner case. As downstream usage is centralized, confusion is unlikely.

2- Handle train releases of validations-* out of the openstack/releases repository. Like for Kayobe (which had its own 'train' releases before it was added officially to OpenStack), use direct tags to produce releases on that specific branch. That means the tripleo team has to special-case how to do train releases, but avoids setting a precedent.

3- Fully recognize that TripleO is not likely to attract multiple vendors, and push it out of OpenStack multi-vendor governance and rules. TripleO could have its own domain on opendev and write its own rulebook as to what is acceptable to do in old releases.

None of those options is ideal."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-04-01 10:36:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hello there,

hm, seeing the amount of questions|issues this raises, I'll check with our side if we can take what's coming from master (and, when branched, from ussuri) - the release cycle of osp has changed a bit and will heavily rely on backports anyway... Hopefully I'll get some more inputs today already and be able to update this change - maybe even drop it. That would probably be the best."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2020-04-01 12:38:50.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

After some discussions downstream, we're able to track the master branch for now and wait for the split to ussuri.

So we won't be the exception :).

Thank you for all your feedbacks and info!"}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-04-01 12:53:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks Cédric!'}]

commit_message:
Pin puppet-lint-unquoted_string-check

... because puppet-lint-unquoted_string-check requires Ruby~>2.4, since

Do you know how to deal with this?: "sudo: a password is required" in task "Gather the logs to /tmp"'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16615, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:37:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-02-04 20:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Arie, you need to be sure that the role works without sudo on localhost. That is by design and also enforced by zuul where you cannot sudo.

If you see sudo error it means that you tried to sudo on localhost, probably due to become being inhered from somewhere. Either way you need to be sure that all tasks on localhost do run with "become: false". 

I hope this helps. I can be bit tricky to figure out where the become comes from, especially when doing a delegate_to. Still, overriding it at task level works.'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-02-04 23:46:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-03 20:48:26.000000000', 'message': "Extend infrared molecule tests

This changes extends infrared molecule tests with an actual
execution of infrared with this role.

In order to properly test the execution of this role with infrared,
this change includes tasks which create dummy files and verifies
they have been collected once infrared execution is complete.

Also, this change adds an option to infrared's plugin.spec where
one can disable the cleanup of collected files. This is required
since we would like to verify that infrared was able to collect
the dummy files using this role. It is also good in case you just
want to collect files, without publishing them anywhere.

Change-Id: If14fd9130ddb07469cb12fbc0b72f16884b55949
"}, {'created': '2020-02-03 20:53:51.000000000', 'message': "Extend infrared molecule tests

This changes extends infrared molecule tests with an actual
execution of infrared with this role. The execution makes use of
multiple options like archiving large files, changing local working
dir and collect specific files.

In order to properly test the execution of this role with infrared,
this change includes tasks which create dummy files and verifies
they have been collected once infrared execution is complete.

Also, this change adds an option to infrared's plugin.spec where
one can disable the cleanup of collected files. This is required
since we would like to verify that infrared was able to collect
the dummy files using this role. It is also good in case you just
want to collect files, without publishing them anywhere.

In order to properly test the execution of this role with infrared,
this change includes tasks which create dummy files and verifies
they have been collected once infrared execution is complete.

Also, this change adds an option to infrared's plugin.spec where
one can disable the cleanup of collected files. This is required
since we would like to verify that infrared was able to collect
the dummy files using this role. It is also good in case you just
want to collect files, without publishing them anywhere.

Change-Id: If14fd9130ddb07469cb12fbc0b72f16884b55949

commit_message:
Extend infrared molecule tests

This changes extends infrared molecule tests with an actual
execution of infrared with this role. The execution makes use of
multiple options like archiving large files, changing local working
dir and collect specific files.

In order to properly test the execution of this role with infrared,
this change includes tasks which create dummy files and verifies
they have been collected once infrared execution is complete.

Change-Id: If14fd9130ddb07469cb12fbc0b72f16884b55949

messages:
[{'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-03-25 09:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-03-25 09:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-03-30 21:25:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

sorry but i'm not convinced on blanket doing this across all these instances; basically if it ain't broke, don't fix it.  Most of these seem to be written to remove a file that is expected to be there, and if it isn't then something has changed.

Is there a specific problem where we have assumed something is created/a file, but that assumption has become incorrect and the rm fails?"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-04-01 12:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

this was related to an issue that is now fixed'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 09:35:48.000000000', 'message': 'Use rm instead of rmdir and force it

Change rmdir to rm -fr for a proper dir clean and force rm in some
cases to ignore nonexistent files/dir and never prompt, as this could
bring to unwanted behavior.

Change-Id: Ia0cf648cd845d34ba0724158f4b27081c8d67180
'}]
commit_message:
Use rm instead of rmdir and force it

Change rmdir to rm -fr for a proper dir clean and force rm in some
cases to ignore nonexistent files/dir and never prompt, as this could
bring to unwanted behavior.

Change-Id: Ia0cf648cd845d34ba0724158f4b27081c8d67180

commit_message:
Update peers with API addresses

Use default_update_peers which will publish admin, internal and public
addresses to peers.

Change-Id: I1bf1f7272ab42c248ae86fede17c5cdd5f3892bc
Closes-Bug: #1858132

'}, {'created': '2020-03-23 17:06:07.000000000', 'message': 'FFWD2 Overcloud upgrade automation.

This is a first draft on the automated workflow to cover the
overcloud upgrade from Queens to Train. A lot of code has been
restored from the upgrade workflow from Rocky to Stein.

In summary, this change will create the overcloud scripts needed
for each of the role hosts (the upgrade is now done node by node)
and change the logic to be able to execute the upgrade for each
of these nodes. To get the nodes per role it relies on the
oc_roles_hosts, a dictionary with all the roles as index and the
hosts (ordered) as values.

In an iteration, a further cleaning up of the all FFU remaining
code will be done.

Change-Id: Idd0bb509c6673e96859fc479b08d33317d9249ea
'}, {'created': '2020-03-23 20:34:06.000000000', 'message': 'FFWD2 Overcloud upgrade automation.

commit_message:
FFWD2 Overcloud upgrade automation.

This is a first draft on the automated workflow to cover the
overcloud upgrade from Queens to Train. A lot of code has been
restored from the upgrade workflow from Rocky to Stein.

In summary, this change will create the overcloud scripts needed
for each of the role hosts (the upgrade is now done node by node)
and change the logic to be able to execute the upgrade for each
of these nodes. To get the nodes per role it relies on the
oc_roles_hosts, a dictionary with all the roles as index and the
hosts (ordered) as values.

In an iteration, a further cleaning up of the all FFU remaining
code will be done.

Change-Id: Idd0bb509c6673e96859fc479b08d33317d9249ea

supports Python 3.

Fix problems found.

Update local hacking checks for new flake8.

Remove hacking from lower-constraints, it's not needed there.

commit_message:
Update pyScss to 1.3.7

pyScss 1.3.4 is not compatible with setuptools 46.
pyScss 1.3.7 was releaed to make it work with setuptools 46.

Note that a workaround for the material design theme
in commit ddc52a7405f0be38629f665d24bcf75022ce0018 is not backported
in this change as the workaround is a partial fix of bug 1771559.
Instead, a release note to mention this as a known issue is added.

python-memcached in test-requirements.txt is updated to
pass the requirements-check job.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/716004
Change-Id: I336a3449c1ed8be3984da6366e9b45f8e4d3f5c0
(cherry picked from commit 2c44702724f25c8114e1a7318d45cd0f87a6c131)

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: Icd7019c924386fb9c047fc55fb98e45fcb79f2eb
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Have 1 dhcp agent per undercloud network

Because we don't support clustered undercloud, we need only one dhcp
agent per network.
Unset NeutronDhcpAgentsPerNetwork parameter to unset the corresponding
parameter in neutron, which should result that neutron use the default
value, 1.

Change-Id: I26ed1c99a60d1c6bdaec9fc5e289bd8b5e4aba0c
